Josefina runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Josefina has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, detergent, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Nery Migdalia

texts.es:
La señora Nery, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Hace aproximadamente 1 año y medio ella siente la necesidad de buscar ingresos para su hogar y decidió dedicarse a vender mercadería como ser: vestidos, camisas, pantalones, carteras, bolsos y otros que le pidan sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y también llegan a su casa a comprar, su negocio es conocido y tiene clientes fijos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por Lps.15,000.00 para surtir de mercadería, comprara bolsos carteras y ropa para sus clientes.
Espera un crecimiento en el negocio y con las ganancias que genere llegar a tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Nery is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. About a year and a half ago, Nery felt the need to generate income for her household. She decided to sell merchandise such as dresses, shirts, trousers, wallets, bags, and other items that her customers request. Her sales are conducted as a street vendor, but she also sells from her home. Her business is recognized and she has established customers.

Nery is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that she can restock with more merchandise. She will buy bags, wallets, and clothing for her customers. Nery hopes to grow her business and use the revenue she generates to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, dresses, wallets, and bags.

loans.name: El Pedregal De San Jorge (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Pedregal De San Jorge. 
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios que hasta la fecha tienen. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga es una muy buena ama de casa que  para ganar  algo por sus propios medios y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y también ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha sus momentos libres y cuando está desocupada para realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender, lleva en este negocio 4 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the solidarity group "El Pedregal de San Jorge" meet every 15 days in the San Jorge neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of "Los Reales Tamarindos". This group of individuals decided to join together some time ago and form this Communal Bank, which has now received many loans. To this date, they have been able to improve their small businesses. They engage in various activities such as agriculture, general trade, services, and other businesses.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Miriam, age 38. She is married and has three chidlren (ages 15, 12, and 8). The two older ones are in high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

Miriam is an excellent homemaker who earns her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). Miriam also sells clothing through catalogs. Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door. She takes advantage of her free time and moments when she is not busy in order to make a sale. Miriam extends credit and collects payments on a weekly basis. She says that she enjoys selling and has done very well in the four years she has been in business.

Her loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and all types of clothing. Miriam has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the help that the loans have given her. Her dream is to continue forward in her business.

The two small photos are of three members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and clothing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a copra (dried coconut meat) business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut for her copra business.  She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from selling coconut shells. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for her copra business.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 32 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Crisanta is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Crisanta has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 43 years old and married with two children.

Fortunata works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store. Fortunata has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

Fortunata aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is married and has five children. She is 38 years old and resides in Nacional, Jimenez, Philippines. 

Jeanette owns and operates a gardening business to earn a living and she has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This year, Jeanette joined GDMPC. In the future, Jeanette wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 41 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Mira is in the agricultural business of raising hogs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Mira has been raising hogs for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Mira would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is from Iraq. She is 56 years old, widowed, and has two children. 

Halima is a seamstress and she is been in this field of work since 1998. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has a deep understanding of the local customers and knows about their needs. She also has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Halima is requesting a $3,000 loan to purchase three sewing machines. She is aiming to increase her production and earn more profits to buy new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase three sewing machines

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 32 years old and married with one child.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store. Elsa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from E-loading. Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Luzvisminda requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Luzvisminda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 51 years old and married with eight children.  With four of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosenda runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. Rosenda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, soap, sugar, and other groceries. In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 61 years old and married with three children.

Marciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Marciana has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 37 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marciana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila works hard to support her family. Mila is single and has a business selling dressed chicken and meat in the Philippines. Mila has been in this business for a year now, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Mila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more meat and dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Mila would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat and dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Minerva requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, ice and salt for her fish vending business.

In the future, Minerva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and salt for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle, 34, is married and has four children. Three are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rochelle has a sari-sari rstore in the Philippines. Rochelle has been in this business for four years.

Rochelle requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, soft drinks etc. to sell in her store.

In the future, Rochelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, soft drinks, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Novy

texts.en:
Novy is 55 years old and married. She has seven children with one in school, Novy works very hard to provide for them.

Novy runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. Novy has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, detergent and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Novy would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 55 years old and married. She has five children. Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines. Letecia has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as rice, biscuits, shampoo, detergent, soft drinks, candies, and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

In the future Letecia would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business  and a pit-fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business and more feed for her pigs.

NWTF is relisting Emma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional products for her general store and feed for her pig-fattening business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a freezer and ice cream for ice-cream sales business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and widowed. She has six children.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita has been farming vegetables for four years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. 

Teresita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en:
Jenevie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. has been in this business for 2 years now.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business. In the future, Jenevie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Bibirobiya

texts.en:
Bibirobiya is a hardworking woman. She is a widow. 12 years ago her husband died and Bibirobiya stayed alone with two small children. They had a difficult life. She earned enough to live by working in the field after work. Once she was ill and went to the hospital for a long time. When her health became better she began her own business. 

She has a big livestock farm. She has been busy with this kind of business for more than 10 years.  The local people buy meat and milk from her.  Bibirobiya’s son and his wife help her in the business. Her aim is to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 20 and married.

Hashem has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,400 youth loan in order to renovate his market and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his market and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 37 years old and a single mother of one child.  She runs a tailoring business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  She has employed two people in the business.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  She hopes to grow her business and employ more people.  She has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has 2 children who are in school. She has a business of selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell. In the future, Genevieve would like to save money to expand her business and send her two children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married and has two children.  She sells small dried fish (omena) to earn a living.  She has engaged in the business for only one year. Previously, she was selling clothes.  She has managed to grow the business through Faulu Kenya.  This is because she has been trained on business management skills. She dreams of growing her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to add stock of small dried fish (omena).

loans.use: To add stock of small dried fish (omena).

loans.name: Rosemalin

texts.en: Rosemalin works hard to support one child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosemalin requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of a brownout. She is aware that by using the disk lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. In the future, Visitacion would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 42 years old and married with 7 children. With 5 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buying and selling of nipa (woven palm mats) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mui was born in 1979. She has one daughter who is now in secondary school. Her husband is a worker. Mrs. Mui’s main income is from selling dog meat and growing rice. She has worked in this field for 3 years and earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Mrs Mui joined the SEDA credit program in 2007.  In previous loan cycle, she had a loan of 7,194,000 VND and repaid on time. This time, she would like to borrow 9,374,000 VND in order to develop her own small restaurant.

loans.use: to develop her own small restaurant

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 52 years old and married with 1 child. Aurelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other miscellaneous items. Aurelia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Aurelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Pc1 Bambilor Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a tété crée depuis le 01/06/2012 il est composé de femmes habitants d'un même quartier et des 

quartiers environnants .

Les membres qui le composent sont unis par des liens sociaux et partagent des valeurs sociales communes.

Madame Maguette est une femme mariée âgée de 58 ans elle est mère de 7 enfants dont 5 filles et 2 garçons.

Elle fait du commerce de détails par la vente de poissons secs depuis longtemps. Maguette dispose d'une bonne

expérience . Avec son nouveau crédit de 50000 frans  elle compte se procurer du poisson sec et des gateaux 

quelle va revendre au détails.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de payer les frais de transports de ses enfants qui vont à

l'école et d'épargner dans son compte au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group has been created on June 1, 2012. It is composed of women living in the same neighborhood or nearby. The group members maintain social ties and share the same social values.

Mrs. Maguette is a married woman, 58 years old. She is the mother of seven children, five girls and two boys.
She  has been retailing dried fish for a long time. Maguette has plenty of experience. With her new loan of 50,000 West African francs she plans to buy fish as well as  baked treats for retailing.

The income generated by her business will allow her to pay the transportation costs  for those of her children who  are in school as well as to grow her savings on her banc villageois account.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and baked treats [for resale].

loans.name: Felisicima

texts.en:
Felisicima is 44 years old and married with 6 children. Felisicima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her general store. Felisicima has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Felisicima aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es:
Prudencio es viudo y tiene cuatro hijos que están en etapa escolar , viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos por los trabajos que realiza como carpintero por más de doce horas al día ya que recibe contratos es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar  materia prima como ser madera, pegamento, clavos etc., y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos de su familia ya que tampoco cuenta con seguro médico.
El sueño de Prudencio, es construir más habitaciones y dar más comodidad a su familia para mejorar la calidad de vida y también ampliar su taller para mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Prudencio is a widower and has four children at school. They live in their own house, which has three rooms with brick walls and an earth floor. The house is located in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz.

Prudencio currently receives income from the more than 12-hour days he works as a carpenter. He is contracted to do this work, and has requested this loan to buy raw materials such as wood, adhesive, nails, etc. With the little he earns he meets his family’s food, education and medical costs, as he does not have medical insurance.

Prudencio’s dream is to build more rooms and provide his family with greater comfort to improve their quality of life. He also wants to expand his workshop to improve his income. This is the second time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy materials to carry out his work.

loans.name: Yagut

texts.en:
Yagut is 43 years old and married with three daughters. She is market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She has 20 years of experience and has deep knowledge of market and demand of clients. Her pension is not enough to cover her basic needs and she decided to start her own business. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 170 AZN.  He daughter helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of her  home city.

She applied for 1500  AZN loan in case to purchase more food products and diversify her range of goods to cover customers` demand.  This will be her 3rd loan and she has been a good client.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty. He is single and lives with six family members.

Since 2012, Ziad has owned a shop selling women’s accessories and perfumes. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1,800 as youth loan to install aluminum windows for the shop and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits so he will be aible to provide a better life stadanrd his family.

loans.use: to install aluminum windows and add more goods

loans.name: Kumrinisso

texts.ru: Кумриниссо, молодая женщина в возрасте 41 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. На рынке она работает почти 6 лет, торгуя различными тканями. Сейчас у нее начинается летний сезон продаж тканей, и торговля идет хорошо. Поэтому она планирует на полученный кредит привезти широкий ассортимент товара. Ее занятие является основным доходом для семьи, так как ее муж работает в государственном учреждении и его зароботной платы не хватает даже на семейные рассходы. Кумриниссо с мужем выражают свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Kumrinisso is a young woman, 41 years old, married, with three children. For almost six years she has been selling various types of fabric at the market. At present she is beginning to sell seasonal fabric for the summer, and  her business is going well. This is why she plans to use her loan to bring a large assortment of goods. Her business is the main source of income for her family as her husband is a state employee, and his salary is insufficient even for household expenses. Kumrinisso and her husband thank our organization for this financial support.

loans.use: to expand her business [by stocking up on fabric for resale].

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 23 years old.  He is single and lives with five family members, three of whom work.

Mohamad has owned a cafeteria since 2012, offering hot drinks and juices. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Gloria runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, bread, shampoo, soft-drinks, and beverages. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia ocupando nueve habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos trabajando como albañil por más de diez horas ya que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos ya que tampoco cuenta con seguro medico para su familia.
El crédito lo solicita para el terminado de sus habitaciones ya que las paredes solo son de ladrillo y ahora quiere hacer la obra fina con estuco y el pintado para  mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Valentín, es mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos ya que algunos entraran a la universidad.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Valentín is married and has two children.  They live in their own house, occupying nine rooms.  The house is located in the Munypata area of the city of La Paz.

He only attended elementary school.  He currently gets income from working as a bricklayer for over ten hours a day.  His work is very difficult.  With the little that he earns, he needs to cover the food, education, and medical expenses.  He does not have medical insurance for his family.

The loan that he is requesting is to finish the rooms because the walls are only brick.  Now he wants to do the finishing work with plaster and paint.  He wants to do this to improve his quality of life.

Valentín’s dream is to improve his income in order to be able to pay for his children’s education, which includes attending the university.  

This is the fourth time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the third time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy plaster and paint to do the finishing work on the rooms of his house.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 48-year-old man who is married with three children. Saleh has been breeding sheep for the last 20 years. His pension was too small to cover the needs of his family and he decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle. 

Saleh usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for three to five months, and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 100 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Saleh also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1600 AZN loan to purchase 15 sheep and one milk cow. This will be the fourth loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and one milk cow

loans.name: Agaseyid

texts.en:
Agaseyid is a 59-year-old man who is married with five children.  He has bred cattle for the last 30 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, he purchased his first cattle.

Agaseyid usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN and this business is only one source of income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Agaseyid also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 
 
He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase two cattle and one milking cow. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milking cow.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is a 51-year-old man who is married with two children. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Ilqar has 22 years of experience in this field, in which he is considered a knowledgeable and skilled person. 

The food products he sells are very popular and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 120 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of his home city. 

Ilqar would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1800 AZN. He will diversify by purchasing additional foodstuffs. This will be his fifth loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc was born in 1958. She has a son who is a construction worker. Her husband is a farmer. Cuc helps her husband to grow rice and also has sold pig hash in the market for five years. Each month, she earns about 4,000,000 VND, her husband earns 3,000,000 VND, and the total income of her family is about 7,000,000 VND. Cuc has taken part in SEDA's crediting program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND for about 50 weeks to enlarge her business in the market.

loans.use: to enlarge her small pig hash restaurant in the market.

loans.name: Samorn's Group

texts.en:
Samorn is married and has two children, one boy and one girl. Both of her children are still in school. Samorn and her husband have been farmers for 15 years. 

Samorn and the other group member have been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Samorn's previous loans have helped her family to have sufficient food to eat. Samorn and her fellow member requested another loan after they completely repaid the previous loans. Acting as the group leader, Samorn used her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice field and really hopes this loan will allow her to have enough reserve for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 40-year-old woman who is married with four children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She has seven years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demands of her clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 80 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). Her husband helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the only income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location, in the central bazaar of her home city. 

She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify her range of goods to cover customer demand. This will be her fourth loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 40-year-old man, married with two sons. He is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last six years. During these years Elchin gained enough skill and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in an Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 130 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). 

As these products are in high demand, Elchin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1200 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his second loan and Elchin has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es casada y tiene dos hijos  que están en etapa escolar, tienen casa propia ubicada en la zona  Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudió solamente hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos de su tienda de abarrotes, es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de refrescos enlatados para incrementar sus ingresos  ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia. Trabajando por más de doce horas al día y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para aumentar su mercadería. Su esposo trabaja en Oruro trasladando ladrillos y alguna vez le envía dinero para cubrir algún gasto.
El sueño de Paula es ampliar su tienda y tener variedad en productos para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos universitarios de sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Paula is married and has two school age children.  They have their own house, which is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

She only attended elementary school.  She currently earns income from her grocery store.  She is requesting the loan to buy canned soft drinks in order to increase her income.  It is the only income she has to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

She works 12 hours a day, and the little amount that she earns is not enough to increase her merchandise.  Her husband works in Oruro moving bricks.  Sometimes he sends money to cover an expense.

Paula’s dream is to expand her store.  She also dreams of having a variety of products to improve her income.  She wishes to be able to cover her children’s university expenses.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy canned soft drinks, which her customers ask for a lot.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nina works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Nina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.
Nina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Soledad has been in this business for 20 years. Soledad earns more income from raising livestock.

Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en:
Hikmat is a 53-year-old man who is married and has three children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Hikmat has 10 years of experience in this field, in which he is considered as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaronis, yoghurt, ketchup, sugar and others. Products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life.  Also these products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 120 AZN. His spouse helps him to update merchandise in his shop. 

This business is only one financial income for his family and Hikmat would like to increase his sales as well as to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.
Juanita has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old and has 8 children. Norma is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Norma is in an agricultural business farming bell peppers in the Philippines. Norma requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her bell peppers. Norma has been farming bell peppers for 3 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to improve her agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her bell peppers

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and has 5 children. Letecia is widowed and has one child who is in school.

Letecia is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Letecia has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is a 51-year-old married man with three sons. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter and candies. He has 20 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demands of clients.
 
The food products he sells are very popular among people and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 100 AZN.  His son helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for his family. Mehman is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location in the central bazaar of his home town.

He applied for 1,500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify his range of goods to cover customer demand. Mehman has a good client history and this will be his third loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es:
Con su mesa para colocar su comida, dos estufa que cubre con pedazos de zinc para evitar el paso del viento que no apague las calorosas llamas de las estufa y sobre las que coloca  dos grandes porras donde elabora su vigoron platillo típico de la ciudad de Granada, aunque no tenga un  lugar lujoso y solo cuente con sus sencillos artículos asi se gana la vida Leonila una humilde habitante de Granada, ella es originaria de Managua pero desde niña fue criada en Granada, casada, tiene hijos mayores de edad que viven independientes. Ella inicio su actividad vendiendo sus fritangas y refresco en su domicilio a la edad de 35 años, luego con esfuerzo propio y arduo trabajo diario fue invirtiendo en su negocio hasta hacerlo mas sostenible, este a sido su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de sus hijas, sus productos los comercializa en un local ubicado fuera de la casa, lugar que tiene mucho acceso para la comercialización de sus productos y en donde cuenta con  clientes fijos. Uno de los hijos que trabaja como taxero le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Solicito el crédito para comprar un  frízer  y insumos tales como frutas para sus bebidas, vegetales para hacer la ensalada, carne, arroz, plátanos, etc, toda la materia prima para elaborar sus refrescos y sus platillos, el frízer lo quiere para ofrecerle productos frescos a sus clientes, se siente satisfecha en el negocio pues le va bien mantiene sus ventas, sus meta es salir adelante y comprarse su carro ya que se considera una persona con deseo de superación, responsable, honesta y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Leonila has a table to put her food on, two stoves that she covers with pieces of zinc so that the wind does not blow out the hot flames from the stove, and two large pots that she puts on the stove to make her  “vigoron”, a typical dish in the city of Granada.

Even though she does not have a luxurious place, and she only has her simple things, this is how Leonila earns a living.  She is a humble inhabitant of Granada.  She is originally from Managua, but ever since she was a little girl she was raised in Granada.  She is married, and she has adult children who live independently.

When she was 35 she started her business activity of selling fried snacks and soft drinks at her house.   Later, with her own effort and daily hard work she was investing in her business until she made it sustainable.  This has been her first business where she gets the support of her daughters.  She sells her products at a place located outside of her house.  This place is very accessible for selling her products, and she has fixed customers.  One of her sons works as a taxi driver, and he helps her with the household expenses.

She requested the loan to buy a freezer and supplies like fruit for drinks, vegetables for salads, meat, rice, and bananas, etc.  She will buy all of the ingredients to make her snacks and dishes.  She wants the freezer in order to offer her customers fresh products.

She is pleased with the business.  Maintaining her sales is going well for her.  Her goal is to get ahead and to buy a car.  She considers herself to be a responsible, honest, and hard-working person with the desire for self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and supplies like fruit for drinks, vegetables for salads, meat, rice, and bananas, etc.

loans.name: Manfredy

texts.es:
Manfredy, está solicitando un préstamo pues tienen la oportunidad de adquirir ganado para sus potreros, se comprará tres terneros para la crianza, con el objetivo que el futuro estos le pueda generar un mayor ingreso.
El manifiesta que el credito anterior le ayudó para mantenerse en el negocio, realizó la inversión que deseaba,comprandose terneros,  con el dinero que le ha generado ganancia lo ha invertido en su familia para apoyarles y mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Manfredy is requesting a loan because he has an opportunity to acquire some livestock for his paddock.  He will buy 3 calves to raise.  His goal is to generate more income in the future with these animals.

He states that his prior loan enabled him to maintain his business.  He made the investment he wanted to make, purchasing calves.  With the profits that he generated from this, he has invested in his family to support them and improve their conditions.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y cuyes y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos secos como maiz,cebada y trigo y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jora,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de productos secos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar alimentos para los animales y tambien para comprar maiz,cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicia continues to raise small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She also has a business selling dried grains, such as corn, barley and wheat, and she also continues to sell jora (a traditional Peruvian beverage).  Through these small businesses, she is supporting her children.  Felicia wants to expand her business raising animals and selling dried grains.  She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and also to buy corn, barley and wheat. 

Felicia is pleased to be receiving this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai was born in 1978. She has just given birth to her two little sons. Her husband works as a porter to gain an earning of 3,000,000 VND for her family. She is a tailor as well as a farmer who raises chickens, pigs, ducks and rice to afford her own family’s living expenses. She can get 4,000,000 VND per month. Thus the family’s income could be 7,000,000 VND a month. She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND within 50 weeks to raise animals.

loans.use: to raise animals to sell

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres en una casa en alquiler ocupando tres habitaciones, la misma ubicada en la zona Rosales de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente estudia en la universidad en la carrera de Derecho, es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar una laptop que será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios, ya que actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas como empleado en una entidad pública en la ciudad de La Paz.
El sueño de Mauricio es terminar su carrera y mejorar sus ingresos para poder obtener una casa en anticretico y de esta forma ayudar a sus padres y ahorrar ya que con lo poco que gana solo ayuda en pagar los servicios básicos de su familia, también desea a futuro  pagar un doctorado en derecho.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mauricio is single, and he does not have children.  He lives with his parents in a rented house, occupying three rooms.  The house is located in the Rosales area of the city of La Paz.

He is currently studying at the University for a Law Career.  That is why he is requesting the loan.  He wishes to buy a laptop, which would be of great help in his studies.  He is currently working over ten hours a day as an employee of a public entity in the city of La Paz.

Mauricio’s dream is to finish his career studies and to improve his income.  He wants to do this to be able to get an“anticretico” (a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent; at the end of the rental period, the tenant receives the sum back, in full, from the landlord, thus resulting in rent-free living).  This way he could help his parents and save.  With the little he earns he can only pay for the family’s basic services.  In the future he also wishes to pay for a doctorate in the law.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for his studies.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es casada y tiene un hijo el cual esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus padres ocupando cuatro habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa de varones mujeres y niños más que todo a pedido ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, estudios y servicios básicos de su familia debido a que no tiene otros ingresos. Es por eso que solicita el crédito por que desea incrementar sus productos ahora con la venta de cosméticos para poder cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que no gana mucho y trabaja de forma ambulante por más de doce horas.
El sueño de Irma, es tener casa propia ya que desea dar más comodidad a su familia y también para tener su propia tienda para ya no salir a las calles ya que es muy sacrificado.
Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Irma is married and has one school age child.  They live in her parents’ house, occupying four rooms.  The house is located in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

She sells clothes for men, women, and children.  She mostly sells by order.  She does this to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.  She does not have other income.

That is why she is requesting the loan. She wants to increase the products she now sells by also selling cosmetics.  She wants to do this to be able to cover the family expenses.  She does not earn much, and she works in an itinerant manner for over 12 hours a day.

Irma’s dream is to have her own house because she wants to make her family more comfortable.  She also wants her own house in order to have her own store so that she would not have to go to the streets to sell.  It is very difficult work.

This is the fifth time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y fideos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y fideos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jakeline still sells products to cover the basic needs like rice, sugar, milk and pasta. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. 

With this business she's bringing her children up. Her dream is to expand and improve her business of staple goods.

She requests this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and pasta.

Jakeline is happy because of her loan and is committed to keep paying the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and pasta.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACHAR;él socio continua dedicandose a la construcción de casas, a la vez el socio se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, el siembra lo que maiz y papa, el socio lleva años dedicandose a estos sus negocio el cual el va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso con muchas ganas de continuar adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas para su chacra. 

El socio se siente agradecido por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar" communal bank. He is still building houses. At the same time, the borrower farms and raises livestock. He grows corn and potatoes. 

He has been working in these business for years, and it is going well, thanks to the effort he devotes to it each day. The borrower is a responsible and determined person, who has a great desire to help his family get ahead in life.

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for his small farm. 

He is grateful for the loan he has been granted, and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his small farm.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia,el socio siembra maiz y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar le negocio de agricultura y ganaderia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar fertilizantes y abanos y tambien para comprar alimentos para los ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is still in the farming and livestock-raising business. He grows corn, and then sells it in the various markets. He wants to succeed by means of this business. The borrower's dream is to expand his farming and livestock business. He is requesting the loan in order to buy organic and other fertilizers, and also to buy feed for the livestock.

The borrower is happy about the loan, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: The borrower is requesting the loan to buy organic and other fertilizers, and also to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Leidy Milexy

texts.es: Leidy Milexy, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera,  vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Ella con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche, para mantener al animal cuenta con un terreno de pasto, el cual  cuenta con buenas condiciones para mantener a la vaca. La propiedad cuenta con agua potable para suministrarle al animal. Lo que quiere es poder asegurarse de comprar vaca saludable y que tengan una buena producción de leche de una calidad adecuada y así tener la leche para la familia. Es el primer  préstamo que he recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leidy Milexy is 18, single and lives with her parents and siblings whom are her biggest priority. 

With her loan she wants to buy a cow to produce milk, for the cow's upkeep she has a plot of grass for grazing in good condition for the cows sustenance. The plot has drinking water to give to the animal.

What she wants is to make sure to buy a healthy cow, that will have a good milk production rate of an adequate quality and thus have milk for her family.

This is her first loan with Fudecosur. She had not had other loans with any state-owned banks but Fudecosur has offered her a loan with easier terms and lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milking.

loans.name: Edra Elias

texts.es:
Edra, quiere seguir en su negocio de carpintería, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la inversión en madera de laurel, aceituno, para seguir elaborando los muebles que le solicitan los clientes, su objetivo con esta inversión es ir generando estabilidad en el negocio.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior le ayudó a continuar trabajando y a mejorar su condición económica en la familia, ya que logró realizar los trabajos que eran solicitados por sus clientes, en este período su único problema ha sido la enfermedad de una hermana que le ha ocasionado algunos desniveles economicos.
texts.en:
Edra wants to continue with his carpentry business. He is applying for a new loan in order to buy laurel and aceituno wood, so that he can continue making the furniture that his customers request. His objective is to gradually create stability in his business through this investment.

The results he had with his previous loan helped him to keep working and improving his family's financial circumstances, as he managed to carry out the jobs that were requested by his customers. At this time, his only problem has been the illness of a sister which has caused him some financial strains.

loans.use: To buy laurel and aceituno wood.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio Guido pertenece al banco comunal INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACHAR, el socio continua dedicandose a la ganadería y agricultura ,el lleva buen tiempo en este negocio,el socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia,el socio trabaja todos los dias sembrando maiz y papa para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan.

El socio solicita el prestamo para la compra de semillas y fetilizantes para su chacra. 

El socio se siente agradecido por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower, Guido, belongs to the "Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar" communal bank. He is still farming and raising livestock. He has been in this business for some time. He is a cheerful and responsible person, who has a great desire to succeed for his family's sake.

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for his small farm. He feels grateful for the loan he has been granted, and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for his small farm.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,ella cria chanchos,gallinas y cuyes,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella siembra maiz,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y tambien negocio de agricultura.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,gallinas y chanchos y tambien para comprar semillas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to have her business raising animals. She raises pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. The borrower also continues to farm. She grows corn. She is raising her children by means of this business. 

Her dream is to expand and improve her business raising animals, and her farming as well. She is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs, as well as to buy seeds.

The borrower is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs, as well as to buy seeds.

loans.name: Abel David

texts.es:
Abel, está solicitando un préstamo para poder mejorar la condición del negocio, comprando se  accesorios para la reparación de celulares Carcasas, teclados, llaveros, también se comprará herramientas como llaves y desarmadores para poder reparar.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar el negocio aumentando la mercadería y el buen servicio de reparación a los clientes, su situación económica también ha mejorado.
texts.en: Abel is requesting a loan so that he can improve his business by buying accessories for cell phone repair, including cases, keypads, and key rings. He will also buy wrenches, screwdrivers, and other tools for his repairs. He says his previous loan helped him expand his business, increasing his stock and improving the repair service he can offer his customers. His economic circumstances have also improved.

loans.use: to buy cell phone cases, keypads, key rings, wrenches, and screwdrivers.

loans.name: Yanci Carolina

texts.es:
Yanci, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita dinero para invertirlo en el negocio, se comprará fruta fresca papayas, sandía, pepino, mango, con esta nueva inversión espera tener un buen nivel de demanda por parte de sus clientes.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudó para comprarse más mercadería y asimismo crecer el negocio, esto la motiva a seguir trabajando y seguir ofreciendo a los clientes productos de calidad, ya que esto le permite también mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Yanci has decided to request an additional loan because she needs money to invest in her business. She will use it to buy fresh fruit and vegetables such as papaya, watermelon, cucumber, and mango. She hopes that this new influx of capital will help her increase the demand for her products among her customers. She tells us that the previous loan helped her increase her stock and expand her business, which motivates her to keep working and offering her customers high-quality products. Meeting her clients' needs helps her improve her own economic circumstances.

loans.use: to buy papaya, watermelon, cucumber, and mango.

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
Héctor, está solicitando un préstamo para comprarse un equipo de herramientas múltiples como llaves y desarmadores, esto le ayudará a poder realizar un buen servicio de reparación a los clientes cuando realiza las actividades de fontaneria y ayudante de mecanico.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le dio los recursos necesarios para mejorar las herramientas que utiliza en el negocio, con la que ha podido seguir brindando buen servicio y creciendo en clientela.
texts.en: Héctor is requesting a loan so he can buy a set of tools including wrenches and screwdrivers, which will help him provide good repair service to the customers he serves as a plumber and mechanic's assistant. He says that the previous loan gave him the necessary resources to improve the tools he uses in his business, which has allowed him to continue offering good service and expand his customer base.

loans.use: to buy wrenches and screwdrivers.

loans.name: Rompe Corazones Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ROMPE CORAZONES” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II, esta compuesta por seis integrantes donde la señora Nilsa es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: Fábrica de calzados, venta de cosméticos, brostería, venta de cerveza, servicio de sala de juegos, venta de perfumes.
La señora Nilsa cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de sus compañeras; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos, mismo que trabaja hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de zapatos) los que comprará de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que el seguro de vida y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Heart Breakers” Communal Bank has begun its 1st loan cycle with our “Santiago II” Central Office. The bank is composed of 6 members with Nilsa as president. The group is involved in distinct activities, including making shoes, selling cosmetics, roasting chicken, selling beer, operating a juice vending store, and selling perfumes. 

Nilsa tells us that this is the 1st time she has joined a communal bank within Pro-Mujer. She was invited to join by one of her companions. At present, she sells shoes at a business she has operated for several years, using skills learned from her friends.

The loan she is requesting will provide capital for buying shoes at the fairs in La Paz, then she will sell them in her market stall. This type of work helps her advance her family, since she lives with her common law husband and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied “the life insurance and the medical clinic.”

loans.use: to buy shoes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Ivania, es una mujer trabajadora desde su juventud, tiene la edad de 55 años es comerciante, tiene un puesto de Enabas, donde los productos en granos basico son de bajos costos, teniendo buenas ventas, de sus tres hijos, solo uno vive con ella el cual estudia y trabaja, tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es transportista.
Ivania desea mejorar los cuartos, al anexarle mas espacio, mejorando paredes, techo, puertas, lo que comprara, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, laminas de zinc, perlines y comenzar la obra.
texts.en: Ivania has been a hard-working woman since her youth.  She is 55 years old and is a business woman.  She has a stall through the Nicaraguan basic food program "Enabas" where products like basic grains are sold at low cost.  She has good sales.  Of her three children, only one lives with her, and that child studies and works.  She also counts on the support of her husband who works as a driver.  Ivania wants to improve the rooms of her house, creating more space, improving the walls, ceiling, and doors.  She will buy block, sand, cement, iron, zinc roofing tiles, and purlins (supporting structures for the roof) in order to begin the work.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to remodel and annex rooms.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Doña María, junto a su esposo e hijas, continua con su gran aspiración ella con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio labora para un Hospital con eso ella tiene que ayudar en gastos del hogar y pagar los estudios de sus hijas, su salario no es lo suficientemente alto para terminar de construir y realizar las mejorar en su vivienda. Con este nuevo crédito que le han autorizado podrá comprar parte de materiales  para avanzar  con sus planes. Hierro, Cemento, Piedra, Arena y Piedrín es parte de lo que comprar para su casa.
Muy agradecida con Afodenic quien atravez de fondos Kiva puede apoyarla y cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Maria, with her spouse and daughters, continues her great aspirations.  With great effort and sacrifice, she works for a hospital to help pay for household expenses and the education of their daughters.  Her salary is not high enough to finish building and improving their home. With this new loan she will be able to purchase materials to further their plans. Some of the materials she'd like to buy for her house are: iron, cement, stone, sand and gravel.  Maria is very grateful to Afodenic, who through Kiva funds, can support and fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron, and stone.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo pues tiene la necesidad de realizar la mejora a su vivienda comprando teja, madera y cemento, para algunas partes que le hacen falta para tenerla completamente en buenas condiciones.
Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar y reparar el techo de la vivienda que actualmente se encuentra en perfectas condiciones a través de estos préstamos considera que estará mejorando la situación en la vivienda para tener más comodidad.
texts.en:
Marina has decided to obtain a new loan, as she needs to carry out improvements to her home by buying roof tile, wood and cement. This is for some parts of the house that need work to be fully in good repair.

With the previous loan she managed to improve and repair the ceiling of her home that now is in perfect repair. Through these loans she considers that she will be improving her housing situation in order to have more comfort.

loans.use: To buy roof tiles, wood and cement.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha sigue con su comercio, pues desde que inicio con la venta y compra de cerdos, su vida cambio, al poder tener dinero y ayudar  a los gasto de su hogar, hoy en dia, se esta dedicando a la venta de ropa, zapatos, partes de sus ventas son encargos y siempre mantiene productos, su esposo tambien es comerciante y su hijo es estudiante.
Sus  ventas aumentaron al hacer financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde trabaja por ciclo, con su nuevo prestamo, comprara: ropa, zapatos ropa interior de dama y hombre, ropa de niños y encargos, que tiene que entregar.
texts.en: Martha continues her trade, because since she started selling and buying pigs, her life changed.  To have money and and help pay for her household expenses, today, she is committed to selling clothes and shoes.  Part of her sales are orders and she always keeps inventory.  Martha's husband is also a businessman and her son is a student. Her sales increased by being financed by Afodenic, where she works per cycle.  With this new loan she will buy: clothes, shoes, men and women's underwear, and kid's apparel for orders, which she has to deliver.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Luz De Luna Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LUZ DE LUNA” inicia su decimo segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Zara es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de calzados, venta de celulares, venta de comida, venta de pantalones, venta de cosméticos, venta de medias, venta de frescos.
La señora Zara cuenta que hace cuatro años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de sus compañeras; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medias, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de medias) los que comprarán de las galerías paceñas y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Luz de Luna" communal bank is beginning its twelfth loan cycle through the Juan Pablo II regional office. It is made up of eight members and Zara is the chair. The livelihoods carried out within the group are varied, and include a neighborhood store, as well as businesses selling clothing, footwear, mobile phones, food, pants, cosmetics, stockings and fruit drinks.

Zara says that four years ago, she joined a communal bank within Pro Mujer, and that she was invited to do so by one of her co-members. Currently she has a business selling stockings, which has been operating for several years.

The loan she will now take out is to increase her capital through the purchase of stockings, which she will buy in the stores in La Paz, and subsequently sell at her stand. This way of working helps her family keep going, as she is married and has four children. When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes saving money.

loans.use: To buy stockings.

loans.name: Leo Demostenes

texts.es:
Leo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio y poder surtirlo nuevamente de productos de primera necesidad ya que son muy demandados por sus clientes, Se comprará aceite, azúcar, café, arroz, frijoles, para tener una mayor variedad a los clientes.
El manifiesta haber incrementado el inventario de mercadería con el préstamo anterior, el cual lo considera que fue una buena ayuda para mejorar y estabilizar el negocio, asi mismo ha recibido mayores ventas e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Leo is requesting a new loan to invest in his business and stock it again with basic consumer goods, which are in high demand by existing clients. He will buy oil, sugar, coffee, rice, and beans to provide added variety for his clients.

He has increased his merchandise inventory with the previous loan. He considers it was quite helpful to improve and stabilize his business. His sales have gone up along with the earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, coffee, rice, and beans.

loans.name: José Gregorio Hernandez  (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Gregorio Hernández  se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo atrás y  formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Clotilde, tiene  62 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado diez hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella solo vive una hija. Su marido realiza faenas en el campo.

Nuestra amiga aprovechando que en su casa tiene bastante espacio se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño galpón en el cual mete hasta cien pollos por temporada y tiene un corral donde tiene los chanchos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando están pequeños y  los tiene de tres a cuatro meses y cuando tienen un peso adecuado los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, los mismos que luego los venden en  distintos mercados de las ciudades vecinas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.

Sus sueños seguir adelante y tener buena salud. 

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The José Gregorio Hernández Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people. It is also known for producing the best brandy in the province and in all of Ecuador. This group of individuals decided to join together some time ago and form this Communal Bank, which has already provided them with many loans. They have been able to improve their small businesses. The members engage in various activities involving trade, services, selling food, and other activities.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Clotilde. She is 62 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has 10 grown children. She lives with one of her daughters and her husband works on a farm.

Clotilde takes advantage of the space around her house to raise chickens and pigs. She says that she has a small coop where she can have up to 100 chickens each season and a pen that holds the pigs. Clotilde buys the animals when they are small and keeps them between three to four months. When the animals reach an adequate weight, they are sold to traders who come to her house, who in turn sell them at various markets in the neighboring cities.

This loan will be used to buy feed and medicines for both her chickens and pigs. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank and she likes the speed by which she was able to secure the loan. Her dreams include moving forward and having good health.

The small photo in the corner is of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicines for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 3 menores hijos en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, una zona agrícola productora de mango y limón.

María se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y  aves de corral desde hace más de cuatro años. Ella los cría en corrales ubicados cerca de su domiclio, alimentándolos con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos obtienen el tamaño y peso adecuado los comercializa en el mercado local. Con las ganancias obtenidas, María ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, en los gastos del hogar.
