Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa de bebe, venta de refresco, venta de comida, compra y venta de chatarra, venta de videos, venta de chamarras, 
La señora Palina cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por el Jefe de Centro; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chamarras) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en el departamento de Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es sotera y tiene un hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en: The communal bank “18 DE MAYO” is starting its first loan cycle with Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación. The group is comprised of eight members, and Paulina is the president. The activities that the group members are involved in are diverse - these include the sale of baby's clothing, sodas, food, videos, scrap metal and chamarras (traditional Bolivian ponchos). Paulina tells us that this is the first time a communal bank has collaborated with the organization Pro Mujer, whose director invited them to join. Currently, Paulina has a business selling traditional Bolivian ponchos. She has been doing this for a number of years and learned this trade from her mother. The loan she is currently seeking is for working capital so that she can buy chamarras in the traditional markets of La Paz. She will then sell these in the province of Cochabamba. This form of work will help her to improve her family's situation, as she is single and has a child. When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the classes that they offer in health and finances.

loans.use: to buy Bolivian ponchos for resale.

loans.name: Amigas De Puerto Perez Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “AMIGAS DE PUERTO PEREZ” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Vanesa es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, 
La señora Vanesa cuenta que es hace medio año que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por la promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amigas de Puerto Perez” is starting its second loan cycle with Centro Focal de Copacabana.  The group is comprised of eight members, and Vanesa is the president.  The activities that the group members are involved in are diverse - these include the sale of food, fish, and vegetables, as well as a neighborhood shop.

Vanesa reports that it has been six months since the communal bank formed under the organization Pro Mujer and that they were invited by the staff to join.  Currently Vanessa has a neighborhood shop, and she has worked in this business for several years.

The loan she is currently seeking is to help stock her store with groceries.  She buys these items in the traditional markets of El Alto and later sells them from her shop.  This form of work will help her to improve her family's situation, as she is married and has two children.  When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the training they provide in the areas of health and finance.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and is married with six children with the first-born being twelve years and the last-born being only nine months old. Yusufu is aged thirty-four and has been in farming for five years. He gets additional income from his motorcycle transport business.

Yusufu is has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes he will grow his business to three dairy cows and generate enough income to educate his children and venture into more businesses to spread business risks currently in farming.

Yusufu says the major challenge in farming is currently in shortage of feeds which results in high costs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Than, 40, is widowed and has five children. Some of her children are still in school, and some are garment workers. All five of them live with the family. 

Than is a farmer in Sa Ang district. She has supported her family through this business for 30 years. Than received her first loan from VisionFund in 2010 and is now leading a group of four female members to request another loan after her previous loans ended. As the leader of the group, Than will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice field. She hopes that this loan will enable her to yield better crops and sell the rice at a higher price so that she can set aside some money to pay for her children's school fees until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Reine is a 30-year-old single Lebanese woman living alone. At one time she was in dire financial circumstances, but she worked hard and persevered to enhance her living conditions. In 2007, Reine started to work as a beautician, providing customers with high-quality beauty services at her house or at their locations. In 2011, she opened a clothing store, where she offers a wide variety of clothes at good prices. 

This will be Reine's second Kiva loan, and she is very thankful for the results attained so far due to the previous loan. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase beauty products and cosmetics so that she can improve her business operations and keep up with new fashions. Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high, and that was the reason Reine chose these services.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Wilfredo Jose

texts.es:
Don Wilfredo es transportista, soltero padre de un hijo estudiante, se dedica al transporte, tiene su propio taxi, en donde trabaja cada dia en diferentes horarios, tiene unos clientes fijos de recorrido escolares.lo que para el es de gran sastifacion estas entradas fijas.
Hoy en dia tiene en mal estado su vehiculo, lo que desea comprar las piezas y poder hacerlo trabajar, dando un servicio excelente. Reparara juego de direccion delantera, cambio de chispero, aceite, cable, asi como compra de llantas nuevas para mejor seguridad. Haciendolo mas rapido con el financiamiento que se le otorgara en Afodenic, siendo viable ya que no contaba con todo el capital para hacer estas mejora en su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Don Wilfredo is a taxi cab driver. He is the single father of a son, a student. He works in transport, he has his own taxi, and works different hours every day. He has some regular clients who travel to school which is a great benefit having this regular income.

Currently his vehicle in in bad condition, so he wants to buy parts to make it work, to give an excellent service. He will fix the play in the front wheels, change the spark plugs, oil, cables, and buy new tires for better security. The financial funding is done very rapidly through Afodenic, making this possible because he did not have all the funds needed to make improvements to his vehicle.

loans.use: to invest in buying spare parts for his taxi in order to continue providing good service

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee has seven children aged between 3 and 24 years old, five of whom are enrolled in school. 

She sells animals and has spent 8 years in this business. With the loan, she will buy goats and cows to sell. The profits will be used to pay school fees and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en: Annonciathe is 47 years old. She has been selling beans and sorghum for seven years. She has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Luz, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, su esposo está dedicado al cultivo de maíz frijol y ajonjolí, ella es ama de casa, actualmente su esposo está iniciando el cultivo que ha desarrollado desde hace cuatro años, para esto ella le apoyará solicitando un préstamo e invertirlo en la compra de materiales agrícolas.
Su compra será seis sacos de abono, repartidas en cuatro de sulfato, dos de formula, con esto apoyará a que la nueva siembra tenga los recursos necesarios para la producción.
El objetivo de ella es apoyar familia de la manera más conveniente, poder salir adelante con su hogar y a sus hijos ofrecerle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luz lives with her husband and two children aged 2 and 9.  Her husband grows corn, beans and sesame, and she is a housewife.  Her husband, who has been a farmer for four years, is currently starting to prepare his land for planting.  She is supporting him in this by seeking a loan so that he can invest in agricultural materials.

He will buy six bags of fertilizer, four of which are sulfate, and two of which are mixed formula.  With these necessary resources he will be able to plant his new crops.  Luz's objective is to support her family in the best way possible, so that they can improve their household situation and offer their children a better future.

loans.use: to buy sulfate and other fertilizer.

loans.name: Walter Cesar

texts.es:
Walter, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con sus padres, está casado y tiene una niña de un año de edad, él aprendió el trabajo agrícola con sus padres y desde que formó su hogar hace dos años, trabaja en lo propio.
Ésta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cuatro sacos de abono, una bolsa de herbicidas, considera que éstos son necesarios para poder dar inicio a la siembra de esta temporada, con la intención de obtener una buena cosecha al final del período.
El objetivo de él, es trabajar para poder mantener a su familia, encontrando las alternativas que le permitan crecer en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Walter works in agriculture. He lives with his parents. He is married and has a one year old daughter. He learned farming from his parents and since he started his own family two years ago, he has been working on his own.

Hi is asking for loan in order to buy four bags of fertilizer and a bag of insecticide. He considers these as necessary in order to begin the planting season, with the intention of obtaining a good crop at harvest time.

His goal is to work in order to be able to maintain his family, and to find alternative ways that will permit him to increase his harvest.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer and a bag of insecticide

loans.name: Yenny Edelmira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny Edelmira; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant y también la socia trabaja como profesora del nivel inicial desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes se dedica al negocio de restaurant, ella realiza almuerzos y cenas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant y mejorar en el trabajo de profesora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Yenny Edelmira, belongs to the "Liderando las Palmeras" communal bank, which is located in Cusco, which is in the province and departmental region of Cusco.

Yenny is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates daily between her two professions: her restaurant business and her job as an elementary school teacher, which runs from 8am to 1pm. In the afternoons, she works at the restaurant by serving lunch and dinner. Through this business, she moves her children forward. Her dream is to increase her restaurant business and improve her work as a teacher. She is requesting this loan to buy cooking products such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

Yenny is happy to receive the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua trabajando en una empresa estatal,ella lleva años en este trabajo gracias al empeño que le pone dia a dia ,ella trabaja de lunes a viernes durante el dia,a la vez la socia tiene su negocio de fotocopiadoras el cual se encuentra ubicado pore el centro de la ciudad,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como papeles.

La socia esta agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The communal bank named Virgen de Guadalupe-Cusco is located in the district of Wanchaq in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member continues working in a state business.  She has been in this job for years thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She works from Monday through Friday during the day.  She also has her photocopier business located near the center of the city.  She is a responsible and hardworking person, this being how she gets ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy materials such as paper for her business.

She is grateful for her loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as paper.

loans.name: Joie Plus Group

texts.en:
Guy is the leader of a community bank named “Joie Plus”, which means joy in English.  This group is composed of 28 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Guy is 34 years old and is the father of three children, aged between 9 months and 11 years old. Two of them attend school. Guy runs a cyber café and also sells Forever products. He has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2000. He is working hard because his ambition is to become a Forever product provider in his area. The loan he’ll obtain next will be used to buy a larger quantity of Forever products to resell with the aim of increasing his profits.

As he wants to develop and diversify his business, Guy then decided to join one of Hope’s groups. He makes a profit of about US$150 per week. Guy has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. He always talks with his customers, he knows them well by their names, and he never runs out of stock.

loans.use: buy Forever products to resell

loans.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Bikamwa Plus” is a group of 11 owners of small businesses, chaired by André. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

André is determined to be a successful businessman. He sells pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) at a market located in the mid-eastern area of Kinshasa. He became a microentrepreneur in 1997. André previously received seven loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and has fully repaid them. He intends to use this loan to expand his inventory. He will buy pagnes in bulk and resell them at a profit. Currently he earns a profit of $50 a week. He will seek to make more profit by importing his products himself.

André is 38 years old, married and is the father of three children, aged 2 to 7 -- one of them attends school. His ambition is to someday open a clothing shop.

loans.use: buy print cloth to resell

loans.name: Insaf

texts.en:
This is Insaf, 50, a resident of Lebanon and married to Mikhael. They have one child who is in school. For the past eight years Mikhael has worked very hard at a local company. Both he and Insaf are working together to improve their financial situation and live as life should be.

In order to help him, Insaf decided in 1993 to start her own business as an accountant after gaining years of experience in the field. She has attracted a large customer base that has allowed her to expand her business further and increase her income.

Today Insaf is requesting a 3,000,000 LBP loan from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a car she needs to visit clients and companies for which she works. She is considering opening an office in the future and hiring staff to serve her growing clientele.

loans.use: to buy a car to visit clients and companies.

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala is a 31-year-old young woman who is very friendly and hardworking. She is divorced and lives with her family. Vusala did not receive a degree, so when she divorced she needed to find some other way to support herself. To this end, for the past four years Vusala has grown fruits and vegetables to sell.

During these years Vusala has gained enough skill and experience to run her farm, thanks to her father`s own experience as a farmer. She chose this profession because it is profitable. She usually sells her crops in the central bazaar, earning a monthly income of 120 AZN.

In her country fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. Fruit and fresh fruit drinks are often found on an Azerbaijan family’s table. People also use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes such as pilau and dolmas are made from vegetables.

As fresh produce is in high demand, Vusala wants to expand her farm. She knows producing more fruits and vegetables to meet market demands will increase her monthly income. For this purpose she has applied for a 1000 AZN loan from Aqroinvest Credit Union. With it she will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bole

texts.fr: Bolé est un homme marié.Il est père de trois enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Il exerce dans le transport par motocyclette de personnes depuis près d'un an.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ces besoins et de nourrir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter une nouvelle motocyclette Djakarta.Son ambition est de constituer un parc de motos.
texts.en:
Bolé is a married man. He is a father of three; two of his children attend primary school.
For about a year, he has been in the business of transporting people by motorbike. This activity allows him to provide for his needs and to feed his family. In order to strengthen his working capital, he is requesting a loan for 400,000 XOF in order to purchase a new Djakarta motorbike. His ambition is to build up a fleet of bikes.

loans.use: to purchase a new Djakarta motorbike.

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Thlang is 66 years old, widowed and has no children. Her husband passed away a few years ago. For the past twelve years she has sold vegetables in a local market in Kampong Chhnang Province. She earns an average of 3 USD a day to support herself.

Thlang is applying for a KHR 1,000,000 loan from HKL to buy increased stocks of vegetables to sell in her store. This loan will help to sustain her business and enable her to maintain her living conditions. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her loan and will continue to help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy increased stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1982. She is a member of the Tien Kha loan cluster. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Her husband is a builder and has income of about 4,000,000 Vietnam dongs (VND) per month.

Thanh's main job is farming. She grows rice and vegetables and raises chickens. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and always repays her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy fertilizer for rice and food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice and food for her chickens.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, ya que quiere comprarse un surtido de medicamentos para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, entre ellos llevará antigripales, vitaminas, antibióticos, productos curativos, con lo que podrá ofrecer una amplia variedad, según las necesidades de los clientes.
El objetivo de Tomás es mejorar cada vez el negocio, considera que a través de estos préstamos está consiguiendo la superación ya que ha cambiado la condición del negocio y ha logrado ingresar mayores ganancias a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomás is seeking a new loan to invest in his business.  He wants to have a supply of medicines that he can offer to his customers.  Among these are cold and flu medicine, vitamins, antibiotics and other health products.  He will be able to offer a wide variety of items to meet the varying needs of his clients.  

His goal is to be consistently improving his business.  He reports that thanks to previous loans he has been able to continue to make improvements to his business and has managed to earn higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy cold and flu medicine, vitamins, antibiotics and other health products.

loans.name: Awatiñas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “AWATIÑAS” inicia su cuarto ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, esta compuesta por once integrantes donde la señora María Elena es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: confección de polleras, venta de chompas, costura, ayudante de albañil, lavado de arena, venta de ropa, tejido de mantas, .
La señora María Elena cuenta que hace diez años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una su cuñado; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lavado de arena, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de sus vecinos.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arena) los que comprará de la alcaldía y posteriormente lo venderá en otro municipio. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta los ahorros y el compartir.
texts.en:
The communal bank “AWATIÑAS”  is starting its fourth loan cycle with Centro Focal de Villa Tejada. The group is comprised of eleven members, and María Elena is the president. The activities that the group members are involved in are diverse - these include sewing, traditional dressmaking, blanket weaving, bricklaying, sand washing, and the sale of sweaters and other clothing.

María Elena tells us that it has been ten years since they formed their communal bank under Pro Mujer, and that she was invited by her brother-in-law.  She currently has a sand washing business, which she has worked in for a number of years.  Her neighbors have also learned this business.  

The loan she is currently seeking is for the purchase of sand.  She will purchase the sand through a city agency and later will sell it in another area.  The income from this form of work will help her to improve her family's situation, as she is married and has three children. When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the sharing.

loans.use: to buy sand for later resale.

loans.name: Jorge Heriberto

texts.es: Jorge Heriberto comerciante de la localidad de Chinandega, casado con dos hijos, está  solicitando el prestamos para continuar con las mejoras de la casa, estas consisten en cambio de piso y levantar pared interna de las divisiones, con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como:  arena, cemento, zinc, cal, ladrillos, madera, entre otros.
texts.en: Jorge Heriberto has a shop in the area of Chinandega.  He is married with two children.  He is seeking a loan in order to continue to make improvements to his house.  These consist of replacing his floor and adding new interior walls.  With the loan proceeds he will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, zinc, lime, bricks, wood and other items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, zinc, lime, bricks, wood and other items.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 50-year-old woman, a widow who raises her two children alone. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods like flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has 16 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demands of her clients. Since her husband’s death, she has received social financial support but it is too low to cover her family's demands.

The food products Rahilia sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 200 Azerbaijan new manats (AZN). Her husband helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover her customers` demands.

loans.use: to buy and diversify the range of her food products.

loans.name: Marilenis Alcira

texts.es:
Marilenis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la venta de tortas y panes de pollo, para los cuales necesita comprarse los materiales que interviene en su producción como el pan, las carnes, los condimentos, el aceite, y algunas bebidas, para atender por completo el servicio a los clientes.
Ella manifiesta que el prestamo anterior le ayudó a generar un negocio estable, con una buena producción de alimentos, se aumentó el número de clientes y con esto logrado seguir fortaleciéndose económicamente y poder generar una mejor estabilidad con su familia.
texts.en:
Marilenis is requesting a new loan for the sale of hot sandwiches stuffed with chicken and meat; she needs to purchase supplies involved in making them, like bread, meats, condiments, and oil, along with some drinks to meet all her customers' needs. 

She reports that the previous loan helped her to generate regular business, with a good production of food. She increased her number of customers, which allowed her to continue getting stronger economically and more able to create greater stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, meats, condiments, oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
This business woman, named Mohira, is very effective in her own deals. She concentrates on doing the best to develop her business. She chose a profession that is widespread among women: she is a dressmaker.

Mohira makes the embroidery of the national skull cap for men and women. Mohira buys cloth from Uzbekistan and makes wonderful skull caps to sell to the Isfara region. The skull caps that Mohira makes are very beautiful and every woman wants to wear these skull caps. In business, Mohira is helped by her daughter, who also makes beautiful skull caps. Mohira is married, and her husband is a teacher. They live happily with their four children. Mohira’s aim is to buy a new dressmaking machine to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy a dressmaking machine.

loans.name: Aws

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client and 25 years old. He is married and has three children.

Aws has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1800 as a "Youth Loan” in order to purchase showcases and to increase his inventory. He aims to gain more profit to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase showcases and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 37-year-old married man with two children.  He sells fruits, such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, and bananas.  Elshad has eight years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruits are very popular among the Azerbaijan people and are in high demand during the year.  People like to eat them fresh, and this is one of the main desserts for guests.  His shop is located in the center bazaar, and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits.  His monthly income from this business is 120 AZN.  Elshad's wife helps him sell fruits.

Elshad wants to expand his business.  The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand.  He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover, as well as to improve the life of his family.  For this purpose, he has applied for a 2,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married, and has two children who all work.

Yassine has owned a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to purchase a fridge, generator, and more foodstuffs. He aims to gain more profit to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, generator, and more foodstuffs

loans.name: Hugo Ernesto

texts.es:
Hugo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mayor productos de limpieza comprándose los materiales necesarios como propelin, licol, metil, arcapol, embases, estos materiales son las que interviene en la elaboración de desinfectantes.
Manifiesta que la inversión anterior le ayudó a incrementar el inventario y ya elaborar una buena cantidad de productos de limpieza con los cuales ha sabido ofrecer a su clientela de la zona cercana.
texts.en:
Hugo is seeking a loan to buy products necessary to make disinfectants.  These include propylene, glycol, methyl and other chemicals.

He reports that with his previous investment he was able to increase his inventory and make a good quantity of cleaning products.  In turn he has been able to provide these products to his customers in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to buy materials to make disinfectants.

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es:
Iccel sigue con su comercio, en su pulperia, en donde gracias al esfuerzo y financiamieto tiene bien surtido, mantiene su clientela, al ofertar variedad de productos, su esposo le apoya es comerciante de mariscos y tiene a su cargo dos hijos pequeños.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: granos basicos, productos en carnes, pollo, huevo, queso, pan, productos higienicos, gaseosas, jugos, la inversion toda la  invertira en su pulperia. Ya que su objetivo es fortalecer mas su negocio, y poder hacer las mejoras de su casa mas despues, lo que mas desea es levantar un muro en la parte de atrás que espera comenzar pronto. Siempre pensando en el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Iccel continues with her grocery store where, thanks to her effort and the financing, she has it well-stocked, and she has kept her customer base by offering a variety of products.  Her husband sells shellfish and he helps her.  They have two small children.
She will use the new loan to buy: basic grains, meat, chicken, eggs, cheese, bread, paper products, soft drinks, and juices. She will put the whole amount into her grocery store since her goal is to strengthen the business and to be able to improve her house later on.  She wants to build a wall in the back of the house and she hopes to start soon.  Iccel is always thinking about her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, soft drinks and other products

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with seven children. He lives with his family in a four-room apartment in the Nstualam quarter of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, difficulties in paying school fees for his children, and inadequate business capital.

This will be his fifth loan from GHAPE. He has been a member since 2005. He has been quite successful in the past with his poultry business due to the high demand for his product. He plans to buy six cartons of day-old chicks, feeders, drinkers, and bags of feed.
 
Part of his profit from this loan will be used to take care of his children, buy necessities for his family, and give them good medication whenever they are sick. He will also give some of his profits back to his business. He plans to buy more chicks, feed, trays, and expand his poultry size. This activity will help to reduce the long distance he has to go to buy fowl and improve the availability of nutritious food for his community.

loans.use: To pay for day-old chicks

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 60 años y es viuda con un hijo que tiene la edad de 16 años, ella se dedica a elaboración y venta  de pan ella tiene una panadería muy conocida por la zona,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra harina, manteca y levadura para la elaboración de pan,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener insumos para mejorar la calidad del pan, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de mejorar cada día y crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en  mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. María es una persona muy amable y trabajadora su deseo es el de ver a su único hijo profesional ya que ella sola corre con los gastos del  estudio de su hijo y los gastos de su alimentación.
texts.en: María is 60 years old. She is a widow with a 16-year-old son. She makes and sells bread. She has a bakery that is very well-known in the area. This loan is her third one with the institution. María will use this loan to buy flour, butter, and yeast to make bread. Her reason for asking for this loan is to have supplies in order to improve the quality of the bread. María faces challenges in her business, which are to improve every day and to increase her clientele. She is going to use the earnings to improve her family's quality of life. María is a very kind and hard-working person. Her dream is to see her only son become a professional, since she alone is responsible for the cost of his education and food.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, and yeast

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a 40-year-old married man.  He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar, and beverages in his shop.  Elshan has 10 years of experience in this field, which considers him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products that he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand.  His monthly profit from selling foods is 100 AZN.  His wife helps him to sell products in his shop.  He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, which is in the central bazaar of his home city.

Elshan would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business.  For this purpose, he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.  He will purchase diverse foodstuffs.  This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Malick est un homme marié, père de trois enfants0Il conduit un taxi vélomoteur dans sa ville.Son activité lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de nourriture, de santé et de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants qui vont à l'école.Afin de renforcer ces revenus, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter un nouveau vélomoteur.
texts.en:
Malick is a married man and the father of three children.  

He operates a motorcycle taxi in his town.  This activity brings him a good income, and allows him to feed his children and cover their healthcare costs and education fees, as they attend school.

He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a new motorcycle, in order to boost his income.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Omar Alberto

texts.es: Omar vive en Playas con sus abuelos y tiene 19 años. Se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en tricimoto. Antes de tener la tricimoto, Omar nos cuenta que tenía un carro con el que trabaja de taxista pero sufrió un accidente, gracias a Dios no tuvo ninguna lesión grave. El nos cuenta que estuvo un lapso de tiempo sin trabajar hasta que compro el nuevo vehículo. Hace un año que empezó a trabajar de esta manera y hasta el momento le va muy bien. Omar nos comenta que empezó a trabajar desde muy joven ya que siempre le ha gustado apoyar en su casa. Empieza su recorriendo a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche cobrando una tarifa de $ 0.50 ctv. en su ruta, nos menciona que no pueden cobrar mas ya que compiten con el servicio urbano y su costo es de $ 0.25 ctv. La mayoría de sus clientes son personas que van lejos donde no ingresan los buses, también quienes llevan compras y se les hace más fácil el transporte.  En su trabajo su mayor problema son las calles de su ruta ya que no están pavimentadas por lo que están en mal estado haciendo que su moto sufra averías. Con el crédito Omar le dará mantenimiento a su taximoto que ya lo necesita y arreglara la vivienda de sus abuelos. Su meta a futuro es poder adquirir otro vehículo para aumentar sus ganancias y poder formar una familia.
texts.en: Omar lives in Playas with his grandparents and is 19 years old. He has a service transporting passengers via motorbike. Omar tells us that before he had the motorbike he had a car, with which he worked as a taxi driver, but he was in an accident. Thanks to God, he was not seriously injured. He tells us that he went a period of time without working until he bought the new vehicle. It has been a year since he started working in this way, and up to now it is going very well for him. Omar tells us that he started to work when he was very young, since he has always liked to contribute support to his household. He starts his route at 8 in the morning until 8 at night, charging a fare of $0.50 on his route. He tells us that drivers can't charge more, since they compete with the bus service and it costs $0.25. The majority of his customers are people who are going far out where the buses don't go, and also those who are carrying purchases, and he makes the transport easier for them. In his work his biggest problems are the streets on his route, since they are not paved and are thus in poor condition, causing damage to his motorbike. With the loan, Omar will perform maintenance on his motor taxi, since it needs it, and he will fix up his grandparents' house. His goal for the future is to be able to acquire another vehicle in order to increase his earnings and be able to start a family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Amath Satou

texts.fr: Amath est un jeune célibataire sans enfants.Il tient une boutique de vente de tissus au marché central de sa ville.Il achète en gros dans un pays limitrophe et revend ses produits au détail.Il parvient à générer des revenus assez intéressants qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce , il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique car la première est devenue trop exiguë.
texts.en:
Amath is a young single man with no children.  

He manages a fabric shop at the central market of his town.  He buys in bulk in a bordering country before retailing his merchandise.  

He makes a rather good income which allows him to take care of his needs and those of his family.  

In order to boost his business, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy fabrics and sewing supplies.  

His ambition is to open a second shop, as the first one has become too small.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will buy motor oil, brake fluid, car air fresheners, and other products for her clients.

loans.name: Patococha  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Patococha se está formado por 6 socias y un socio quienes son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma, trabajan diariamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mantener su dependencia económica y solventar los gastos de sus hogares, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos llanuras que son propicias para la ganadería, sus tierras fértiles permiten la agricultura, su arquitectura es una mezcla entre lo antiguo y lo moderno, este lugar nos permite alejarnos del ruido de la ciudad para disfrutar de la tranquilidad del campo. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Robertina, tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo trabaja para solventar sus gastos. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la haciendo en donde laboran.

La Señora. María Robertina labora realizando trabajo del campo desde  hace 20 años, presta sus servicios en una hacienda en donde trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos. 

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando pollos y  alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Patococha" consists of seven members (six women and one man) who are friendly, kind, and have great charisma. They work hard each day in various activities so that they can maintain their financial independence and provide for their household expenses. In addition, they have kept the culture and traditions of their people. The members live in the surrounding neighborhoods of Victoria del Portete Parish in Cuenca. This place has beautiful plains that are suitable for raising cattle, as well as fertile land for agriculture. The architecture is a mix of the old and the modern. This place allows people to get away from the noise of the city and enjoy the peaceful countryside.

One of the members of this group is Sra. María Robertina. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children (ages 19, 17, and 14). Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. The second daughter is a high school student, while the youngest, a son, works to cover his expenses. Her husband is a farm laborer. They do not own a home since they live on the estate where they work.

Sra María Robertina has worked as a farm laborer for 20 years. She works on the estate Sunday through Sunday, but without a set schedule. In addition, she raises guinea pigs and chickens. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank and she will invest in the purchase of chickens and poultry feed. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives with her life companion, who works and helps with the household expenses, and five children, all of whom attend school. She is a happy and hardworking person who is dedicated to her family.

For five years she has had a store in her own home where she sells basic necessities. She sells dairy products, sweetened drinks, and basic grains, among other things. She has good relations with her neighbors and is very collaborative, which makes her one of the most favored when it comes to selling, because they prefer her and this increases her clientele.

Fatuma wants to expand her business; that is, buy more products to have the most complete store in the area. This is why she is asking Yehu Microfinance for a loan to buy more merchandise and basic necessities such as eggs, milk, bread, beans, sugar, rice, and oil, among other items that her customers request but that she still doesn't have.

She is sure that with the profits generated by these new products, she will be able to repay the debt and get a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and basic necessities such as eggs, milk, bread, beans, sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr:
Ernest fait partie du groupe Amani et  habite à Bujumbura.Il  a 45 ans et est marié à Judith, fonctionnaire de l’Etat. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants, âgés de 4 à 20 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz,haricot,huile de palme,sucre,...)  depuis 25ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'articles de sa boutique (riz,haricot,huile de palme,sucre,...), à  revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter sa propre parcelle et voir ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en:
Ernest is a member of the Amani group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 45 years old and married to Judith, a government employee.  Together they have 7 children, ages 4 to 20.  All their children attend school.

Ernest has been selling rice, beans, palm oil, sugar etc. in a shop for the past 25 years.

This is his fifth loan with Turame.  With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy many goods that he will resell in his shop (rice, beans, palm oil, sugar etc.), in order to make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to buy his own plot of land and see his children graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy many goods for his shop (rice, beans, palm oil, sugar...) for resale.

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat will invest the loan in her son’s clothes sales business. Her son has been in this business for the past eight years. After the death of his father, he started contributing financially, along with the earnings of his mother, from his business to the family. 

Jannat is a seamstress by profession. She sews clothes for her neighboring customers and earns income for the family. Her husband’s death was a great loss for her but she never gave up and takes care of her family financially from her sewing business.  

Her son will purchase clothes in larger quantity for reselling. Jannat is very hopeful about his business’ financial growth after this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling in her son's clothes sales business.

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “3 DE FEBRERO” inicia su sexto ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes donde la señora Maribel es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, kiosco, venta de gorras, panadería, venta de construcción, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa intima, tienda de barrio, costura de mandiles.
La señora Maribel cuenta que hace medio año que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una su mamá; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de gorras, mismo que trabaja hace varios años conjuntamente su madre.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de gorras) los que comprarán de las galerías de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el área de salud.
En la foto no se encuentra la señora María ya que se encontrava en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “3 DE FEBRERO” communal bank is starting their sixth cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center. It has ten members and Maribel is the president. The group is involved in diverse businesses. They include selling vegetables, kiosk attendant, selling hats, a bakery, selling salchipapas (a Latin-American fast food), selling underwear, a neighborhood store and sewing aprons. 
Maribel tells us that six months ago she joined a communal bank within Por Mujer. She was invited by her mother. Currently, she has a business selling hats. She has worked for many years with her mother. 
The loan she will receive now is for increasing her capital for selling hats that she will buy at the shopping malls in the city of El Alto. Later, she will sell them from her permanent stall. This form of work helps her to move forward with her family since she has a partner and a child.
When consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the health area. 
María is not in this photo because she was at the doctor’s office.

loans.use: purchase hats.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and has three daughters. 

She is a market vendor and has been selling wheat and flour in her wholesale shop for the last fifteen years. During these years she gained enough skills and experience as well as a wide range of permanent customers in her business.  She sells items with attractive prices and high quality. 

Her monthly income is 130 AZN. Zulfiyya says the location of her shop brought her success and made her business profitable.

Now Zulfiyya applied for 1,200 AZN in order to expand her business and purchase more merchandise. The reason is that demand for wholesale products is high and sometimes Zulfiyya can’t afford all her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, married, and has five children.

Nahla has been a tailor since 2009. She professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2,400 loan to purchase two sewing machines and to add more fabrics. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and to add more fabrics.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy was born in 1965. Her husband is a builder. He earns 3,000,000 VND each month. Her son is now selling phones. Her daughter is in the ninth grade. 

Mrs. Thuy sells tofu in the market and grows vegetables. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND within 50 weeks to buy more soybeans for making tofu and to buy fertilizer for her vegetables. Then she hopes her business could bring in enough money for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to buy more soybeans for making tofu and buy fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is a 52-year-old market vendor. She is married and has four children. Reyhan has been selling food items, beverages, toiletries, detergents, and clothes for the last 20 years. During these years, Reyhan has acquired the knowledge and skills required for her business. She is a very friendly and polite person, and she has regular clients who always come to her shop to buy something. Her spouse helps her sell the products.

Her monthly profit is 138 AZN, and she would like to increase it.  From the products she sells, the most popular are butter, macaroni, cookies, and sugar, and she would like to purchase more of them for her shop. For this purpose, she applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to increase her profit

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 26-year-old married woman who has been living with her husband and lovely young kid in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She grows and harvests rice crops for her daily food as well as for sale. For additional income, she devotes her time to raise poultry at home while her husband goes fishing along the river to provide more income for the family. 

Hong wants to improve her farming business and increase her rice production. So, she decided to borrow a loan of KHR 600,000 to purchase an extra plot of land. She will use this land to produce a fruitful harvest of rice and pay her loan back to our lenders until she completely possesses it. Later, she will be able to make a good income for her family. She hopes that she can raise her family out of poverty in the following years.

loans.use: To purchase an extra plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes, shoes, and handbags

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has five children. She lives in a five room apartment in the Nsongwa quarter, northwest region of Cameroon. As a woman, she has had to overcome some challenges, such as ill health, difficulties in paying her children's school fees, and inadequate business capital. 

Mary has been a GHAPE member since 2005, and thus has received loans four times from them. This will be her fifth time to receive a loan.  She has been quite successful in the past with her farming activities due to high demand for the products. 
 
Mary plans to use her loan to buy and sell fried fish and plantains and pepper soup meat.  She will also use part of her loan to carry out crop cultivation. Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family, give them good medication whenever they are sick, and part will plough back into the farm. This activity will ease the problem of food shortages in the community.

loans.use: to pay for plantains, fish, and meat.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en: Alisher is a very effective business man. He is the owner of a food shop. During the past 10 years, he has tried to comfort the local people with good food, because he wants his fellow citizens to be healthy. Alisher is smart in business, and his store grows each year. His skills always help him. Alisher is married to a beautiful woman. His wife is a teacher, and she helps him with his business. They have five children. Alisher’s aim is to buy an assortment of goods for refreshment.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of goods for refreshment

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir is a 19-year-old student of music at college. He is in his second year of education in classical music. His mother is the only working person in his family, and she pays for his education. Now, Shakir would like to start to work and applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay the tuition fee for his next year.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for his third year of education

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos  hijos en el caserío Punto Nueve, una zona agrícola del distrito de Mocumi en el departamento de  Lambayeque , el cual se encuentra ubicado a más de 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 10 años a la crianza y venta de cerdos, las cuales comercializa entre los negociantes de la zona, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, adicionalmente ella ofrece en su domicilio bebidas gaseosas heladas. Con estos negocios se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria junto a su esposo.

Nancy desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales, así también desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 32-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the village of Punto Nueve. This farming area is in the District of Mocumi, Department of Lambayeque, and is located more than 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Nancy has been raising and selling pigs for 10 years. The animals are sold to traders from the area. She learned this trade from her parents. Nancy also sells chilled soft drinks from her home. Through these businesses, she is able to move her family forward and help her husband meet their daily expenses.

Nancy wants to acquire balanced feed in order to improve the production of her animals. She also wants to make improvements to her home so that her quality of life can get better. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to pay for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is married with seven children. She lives in Mile 90, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She lives with her family in a three room house. Theresia has had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, difficulties paying school fees for her children and inadequate business capital.

This will be Theresia's fifth time to receive a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2005. She has been quite successful in the past with her off-license business due to the high demand for the product. She plans to use her loan to buy and sell drinks and to carry out crop cultivation. 

Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick. Part will be ploughed back into the business. Theresia plans to buy more crates, tables and glasses to expand the size of the bar. This activity will help to create a short relaxing arena for the community.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and for crop cultivation

loans.name: Moma

texts.en: Moma lives with his two children. He sells goats, which he buys and resells at the market in the same municipality in which he and his children live. Moma is requesting a loan, which will enable him to purchase more goats for resale. This way he will be able to have everything necessary to make his business prosper and continue to be profitable for him and his children.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Mario Vicente

texts.es: El señor Mario tiene 23 años casado, tiene un hijo  de un año, el se dedica a la elaboración de dulce desde hace cuatro años, trabaja en domicilio y una vez terminados sus dulces lleva sus productos a vender de forma ambulante en las distintas zonas y mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  esta es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, con el dinero del crédito comprara azúcar por quintales e insumos por mayor ya que esta temporada incrementa el precio de sus productos, por este motivo desea abastecerse de estos productos, el Sr. Mario se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario is 23 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. He has been making candy for four years. Mario works from his home and once the candy is made, he sells his products as a street vendor in different areas and markets within the city of Cochabamba.

This is his fifth loan cycle with Emprender. The money will be used to buy sugar by the quintal (1 quintal = 46 kilograms) and other supplies in bulk. The prices of these products have increased this season, which is why he wants to stock up on these items.

Sr. Mario is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been given to him.

loans.use: to buy sugar and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a dairy farmer who lives in Malindi, Kenya with his wife and four children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by dairy farming. He began by buying a cow and convincing his neighbors to buy milk from his farm. Since then, he has seen his business grow and provide income to his family. Emmanuel is applying for a loan for 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy another cow. His wants to increase the number of animals on his farm, and believes the additional income from these investments will help him achieve his goal. His only business challenge is some customers who do not pay their bills on time.

loans.use: to buy a new cow.

loans.name: Luisa America

texts.es: Luisa vive en Libertad en una casa de su propiedad que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Tiene 58 años de edad y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su propiedad. Está casada con Panfilo quine se dedica a la pesca, sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven independientes. Hace 9 años empezó la tienda ayudada por su esposo quien le dio con el capital inicial. Luego de eso solicito su primer crédito con el cual aumento su inventario. En la actualidad su  tienda está muy surtida por lo que en ocasiones la ayuda su hija menor. En su tienda vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, víveres, atún, productos de limpieza, etc., teniendo una ganancia del 15 % o el 20 % dependiendo del producto. Abre de lunes a domingos de 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Luisa nos comenta que su mayor preocupación son las enfermedades ya que por su edad es propensa a sufrirlas, aparte de eso no tiene mayores problemas. Con el crédito espera comprar productos para vender en la tienda esperando reunir un capital con el fin de comprar una embarcación pesquera.
texts.en: Luisa lives in Libertad, in a house that is owned by her and equipped with all basic utilities. She's 58 years old and runs a grocery store in her house. She's married to Panfilo, who's a fisherman. Her children are adults and lead independent lives. She started the grocery store nine years ago, with help from her husband, who provided her working capital. After that, she requested her first loan, which she used to stock up. Currently, her store is well-stocked, and she gets occasional help from her youngest daughter. In her grocery store she sells rice, sugar, olive oil, salt, provisions, tuna, cleaning producs, etc. She earns a profit margin of 15 to 20%, depending on the merchandise. She opens Monday through Sunday from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Luisa tells us that her biggest concern is illness, since because of her age she's prone to suffer from them, but apart from that she doesn't have major problems. With the loan she hopes to purchase goods for selling in the store, in the hopes of getting enough capital to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, olive oil, salt, provisions and tuna.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Mary  tiene 49 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 8 y 14 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y refrescos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicada en la zona de Pedro Lorenzo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mary va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería por mayor como abarrotes y refrescos, para surtir su tienda de  barrio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su  capital de trabajo, la Sra. Mary enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia.
texts.en: Mary is 49 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 14. She sells basic necessity products such as produce, candies, cookies and beverages in her neighborhood store, located in the Pedro Lorenzo area. This loan is the first one within this institution. Mary is going to use this loan to buy merchandise wholesale, such as produce and beverages, to stock her neighborhood store. The reason she is asking for this loan is to increase her working capital. Mary faces challenges at work such as getting out of poverty. She is going to use the profits to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy produce, candies, cookies and beverages.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad lives in Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and the father of two children. Since 2009, he has owned a shop where he sells women’s perfumes and cosmetics. He has a good deal of experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area. Ahmad is requesting a loan for $2,400 to pay his annual rent and to buy more goods to sell. He is aiming to increase his profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay his annual rent and to buy more goods to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en: Nicat is an 18-year-old student who attends college. He is single and lives with his parents, both of whom are employed. His mother has been paying for his education, but he is now applying for work in several places so that he can pay for his own education. He is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN to cover the cost of next year's tuition.

loans.use: to pay next year's college tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Conrada es una mujer trabajadora, ella cuenta con 50 años de edad y vive en union libre con el señor Daniel es herrero, no tuvieron hijos pues Conrada ya estaba un poco grande cuando decidieron unirse.
Conrada es comerciante, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el mercado municipal del lugar donde habita. Es un pequeño local que renta pues quiere hacerlo más grande pero necesita tener más mercancia para así poder sacar mas ganancias y poder hacer más grande su negocio, ella vende todo tipo de productos para el hogar como son: aceite comestible, arroz, azúcar, cloro, jabones, papel higiénico entre otras cosas, pues ella nos cuenta que le falta comprar otra vitrina para poder meter lo que son: jugos, refrescos, agua enbotellada etc. Pues ya tiene 2 años con su negocio y  quiere hacerlo más grande.
Conradaes una de las integrantes del Grupo Mujeres Unidas, el nombre se eligió porque todos los integrantes son mujeres y son muy unidas, son 14 mujeres trabajadoras y que quieren sacar adelante a sus familias. A continuación serán mencionadas cada una de ellas y  la actividad a la que se dedican: Francisca vende pescados, Clara vende calzado, Efigenia vende comida, Leonarda también vende comida, Isabel vende comida, Wendy vende bisuteria, Irais vende perfumes y ropa, Bernarda vende productos de abarrotes, Maria Elena vende aceites como de coco, papa, etc., Ernestina vende productos de abarrotes, Conrada vende productos de abarrotes, Maura vende quesos, Gregoria vende productos de abarrotes e Hilda vende comida.
texts.en:
Conrada is a hardworking woman. She is 50 years old and in a common law marriage with Daniel. He is a blacksmith. They didn't have children, as Conrada was a little older when they decided to be together.

Conrada is a merchant. She has a small grocery store in the city market where she lives. It is a small locale taht she rents and she wants to make it bigger but she needs more merchandise to make more income. She sells all types of products for the home such as cooking oil, rice, bleach, soap, toilet paper, and more. She tells us that she needs another display case to be able to put in juice, beverages, bottled water, etc. She has had her business for 2 years and wants to make it bigger.

Conrada is one of the members of the Mujeres Unidas Group. The name was chosen because all of the members are women and they are very united. They are 14 hardworking woman and they want to get their families ahead. Below each of them will be listed along with the activity she does: Francisca sells fish, Clara sells shoes, Efigenia sells food, Leonarda also sells food, Isabel sells food, Wendy sells jewelry, Irais sells perfume and clothes, Bernarda sells grocery items, Maria Elena sells oils, such as coconut oil and potato oil, etc., Ernestina sells grocery items, Conrada sells grocery items, Maura sells cheese, Gregoria sells grocery items and Hilda sells food.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as: ham, rice, oil, beverages, juices, etc.

loans.name: Thumbi

texts.en: Thumbi lives in her own home with her husband and their five children, all of whom still attend school. She earns a living by operating a food stall from her home. She sells her food items to people who live nearby and who enjoy the delicious items that she makes every day with dedication and passion. Thumbi has worked all her life to be able to contribute to her household's finances and give her family a higher quality of life. She is requesting a loan through Yehu (a Kiva Field Partner) so that she can buy charcoal and ingredients such as corn, water, wheat flour, maize flour and rice. This will allow her to improve her economic situation and have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and ingredients such as corn, water, wheat flour, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y artículos electrónicos usados desde hace mas de 12 años, es originario del estado de Coahuila, pero esta establecido en esta ciudad desde hace mas de 50 años.  En su domicilio vive con uno de sus hijos y con su esposa. Con los ingresos que se generan de su negocio solventa los gastos de su vivienda y manutención.
Al Sr. Juan le brindan la oportunidad de comprar un lote de computadoras descompuestas y el las va a arreglar y así tendrá mayor volumen de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y obtener un beneficio económico mayor.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living y selling clothes, shoes and used electronics, and has been working in this industry for over 12 years. He is originally from the state of Coahuila, but has lived in his current city for over 50 years. He lives in his home with his wife and children. With the income he makes from his business, he pays his home expenses and maintenance. 

Juan has the opportunity to buy a number of broken computers, which he is going to fix. Then, he will have more inventory to offer to his customers, and therefore earn more income.

loans.use: To buy computers to repair

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Doña Gloria, la presidenta de Banco Mujer Las Laboriosas ha sabido organizar su grupo, con mucho liderazgo y con una influencia muy positiva en sus compañeras. Está mujer de 56, sigue trabajando con mucho empeño y dedicación en su huerta donde siembra todo tipo de hortalizas, este es su segundo crédito y al igual que el primero lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos para sus cultivos.  Esta emprendedora microempresaria logro en muy poco tiempo aumentar su producción y diversificar sus productos, todo gracias al préstamo. Junto a Doña Gloria están en el grupo 7 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en: Gloria the president of the Las Laboriosas Women's Group has known how to organize the group with leadership and a positive influence on the other members. this 56 year old woman keep working with dedication in her garden where she grows all types of vegetables. This is her second loan and as with the first she is going to invest it in buying materials for her crops. This enterprising micro business woman has been able to increase her production in a short time nad diversify her products, all thanks to the loan. With Gloria are 7 more members who are going to invest in fishing and farming activities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, plastic and other materials for planting.

loans.name: Franklyn's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a technical Vocational Institute in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 12,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. Teachers and other monthly staff workers do come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loan, they can meet certain financial challenges that their salaries alone cannot tackle. They usually use these loans to pay school fees for their children, invest in their businesses, buy plots of land or house building materials, etc. And at the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their finance officer is directly responsible for making repayments on their behalf.

Muctarr is the leader of this group of teachers. Muctarr is forty-five years of age. A native of Rokulan village, Muctarr is married to a teacher and they have four children attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Muctarr has served in the teaching profession for 28 years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, bags of cements, iron rods, etc. in large quantity in order to construct a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, bags of cements, iron rods, etc. in large quantity in order to construct a family dwelling house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tricycle and a bakery case

loans.name: La Semillita Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 51 años de edad y está casada con el señor Lucindo con quien tuvo 4 hijos, aunque ya todos están casados y viven con sus familias, ella es parte de un grupo llamado “La Semillita” y platica que le pusieron ese nombre porque se trata de un grupo nuevo y lo van a cuidar para que les traiga buenas cosechas a través de sus créditos. 

Doña Rosa tiene una pequeña cocina económica en un localito sobre la carretera de su comunidad, decidió establecer su negocio en dicho lugar ya que a diario pasan tráilers, autobuses y vehículos y es fácil venderles comida, agua de sabor y refrescos a los choferes. Doña Rosa se levanta diario a comprar los insumos, como legumbres frescas, a la central de abastos de una población cercana a su comunidad. Los refrescos los compra en un carro repartidor dos veces por semana. A las 8 de la mañana, ella comienza a cocinar sus guisados para venderlos en el almuerzo o en la hora de la comida. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que conoce gente de muchos lados del país que pasan antes de continuar sus viajes. Doña Rosa está pidiendo un crédito para comprar los ingredientes que más utiliza para hacer su comida: carne de res, de pollo, de cerdo y legumbres como lechuga, zanahorias, jitomates tomate verde, chiles, cebollas, etc. Ella menciona que en caso de obtener el crédito, su negocio mejorará por el mejor surtido de refrescos que podrá ofrecer; con sus ganancias, tiene planeado seguir invirtiendo para comprar más insumos. 

Los otros diez integrantes del grupo se llaman María Balbina, Adela, María Isabel, María Santos, Edith, José David, María Guadalupe, Diana, Karen Bianey y Rosa María. Ellas invertirán en su negocios de venta de celulares; compra de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños; en una florería; en calzado por catalogo para vender; en frutas y legumbres de temporada; en material para estética; en artículos para abarrotes y, finalmente, en joyería de fantasía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is 51 years old and is married to Mr. Lucindo, with whom she has four children. All of her children are married and live with their famiies. Mrs. Rosa is part of a group called “Little Seeds”. Why they chose this name is because they are a new group and they hope to have a good “harvest” from their loans.
Mrs. Rosa has a small, economical kitchen in her neighborhood, which is on the main highway that runs through the community. She decided to situate her business here as trucks, buses and vehicles pass by daily. It is easy to sell the drivers food, flavored water and soda. Mrs. Rosa rises daily and buys supplies, such as fresh beans, in the supply center of the community. She buys the drinks from a supplier that comes twice a week. At eight in the morning she begins to cook her stews in order to sell them for lunches or mealtime. She says that she likes her work a lot as she gets to know people from all parts of the country that pass by here on their travels. Mrs. Rosa is asking for this loan in order to buy the ingredients that she uses the most in the preparation of her food such as beef, chicken, pork and vegetables such as lettuce, carrots, tomatillos, green tomatoes, chiles, onions, etc. If she receives this loan, with her earnings she will continue to purchase more supplies.
The other ten members of the group are named Maria Balbina, Adela, Maria Isabel, Maria Santos, Edith, Jose David, Maria Guadalupe, Diana, Karen Bianey and Rosa Maria. They would like to invest in their businesses such as selling cellular phones, buying women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, selling flowers, selling shoes from a catalogue, selling seasonal fruits and vegetables, selling cosmetics, selling groceries and finally, selling costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy supplies to use to make different kinds of prepared food for sale.

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Santos, habita en el municipio de  Ticuantepe, junto  a su esposa e hijos, la esposa lo apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella labora para una empresa privada, él trabaja como docente desde hace varios años, con sus salarios no han podido con la construcción de su vivienda  de una sola vez. Gracias  a este financiamiento podrá continuar con  su sueño ya que comprara materiales como. Cemento, piedra, arena, perlines,    zinc y con esto avanzara con la construcción.
Don Santos agradece a Afodenic por confiar nuevamente en el y sobre todo porque ya pronto terminaras su casita.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos lives in the city of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. His wife helps with the household expenses as she works for a private company. Mr. Santos has been a teacher for many years.  With their two salaries they still have not been able to build a house. Thanks to this loan, they can continue building their dream. They will use this loan to buy materials like cement, stone, sand and aluminum siding in order to continue with their construction.
Mr. Santos is thankful to Afodenic, who has confidence in him. In a short time he will finish his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Katumbu

texts.en:
Katumbu lives in Malindi, Kenya. He runs a retail shop which has been in operation for one year. Katumbu is single. He started the business with the assistance he received from his family members.
