He received the invitation to join Milango from his friends. Despite the challenge of price fluctuations, Katumbu believes he can improve his business and is applying for a loan of Ksh 21,050 to purchase retail stock like flour, sugar, milk, cooking oil etc.
He intends to save the additional income obtained from this loan in order to open another retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like flour, sugar, milk, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Odinakhon

texts.en: Odinakhon is a good daughter, lovely wife, careful mother, and perfect business lady. She sells women's cloth in the market. Her 17 years of experience helps her to be effective in business. She knows sophisticated business very well. Her goods have many customers. Odinakhon's husband helps her in the business.  Women who buy cloth from Odinakhon would be wearing wonderful dresses. It is the result of Odinakhon’s skills. Her goal is to buy goods for the new season.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season

loans.name: Frente A La Capillita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Frente a la Capillita, cual esta conformado por seis mujeres originarias de la ciudad Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde una de sus gastronomías  es el coloradito de ti chindas “mejillones de concha de color morado que se pescan en la laguna de corralero.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Alberta Eugenia, mejor conocida como mejor doña Alberta, una persona amable, creativa y trabajadora.
Doña Alberta dice que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son enchiladas verdes, tostadas, quesadillas, tostadas de pollo, empanadas de quesillo y tortas.
Dice que una de las cosas que mas le agradan de su negocio es cocinar y sorprender a sus clientes con un postre ya desea que sus las personas estén contentas de probar sus antojitos.
Una de las cualidades que debe de tener una persona para realizar el trabajo que hace doña Alberta son amable, activa, con higiene y sobre todo alegre para contagiar esa alegría a los clientes.
Dice que una de las cosas más lindas que le han pasado es seguir con su negocio y engrandecerlo cada día un poco más y contar con la ayuda de Vision Found  ya que va poder comprar  más ingredientes para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos.
Las  otras integrantes del grupo son
Leonarda- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Patricia- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Araceli- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Rafaela- se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Santa Brígida - se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Le dan las gracias a Vision Found por apoyar a todas las mujeres humildes con ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is called “In Front of the Steeple”. It is made up of six women from the city of Pinotepe Nacional, Oaxaca. One of their foods of this region is called “coloradito de ti chindas” which are purple mussels that they fish in the lagoons. One of the members of this group is Mrs. Alberta Eugenia, also known as Mrs. Alberta. She is a friendly, creative and hardworking woman.
Mrs. Alberta sells Mexican food such as enchiladas verdes, tostadas, quesadillas, chicken tostadas, cheese empenadas and torts. What she likes most about her business is to cook and to surprise her customers with a desert that they like. Her customers are happy to try her dishes.
Some of the characteristics a person needs to have, in order to do Mrs. Alberta’s job, are to be friendly, active, clean and over all cheerful in order to cheer up the customers. 
One of the things she likes the best is to continue with her business and make it grow. Each day her business grows a little more with the help of Vision Found. She is able to buy more ingredients in order to make her Mexican dishes. 
The other members of the group are:
Leonarda- sells prepared food
Patricia- sells shoes
Araceli- sells shoes
Rafaela- sells tortillas
St. Brigid- sells clothes
They are thankful to Vision Found for their support of all of these humble women who hope to succeed.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to use to make mexican dishes.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a married mother of one school-going child. She had previously worked as a house girl, and had started saving about $23 a month. After two years, she was able to open her retail shop. The shop has been in operation for four years and has been a source of constant income to the family.
She learnt of Milango from her friends and joined in order to access credit for her business. Irene is asking for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like soft drinks, fat, and tea leaves.
Despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time, Irene is optimistic that the sales will increase and she will finally open another retail shop. Her desire is to grow her future chain of businesses into wholesale. The additional income obtained from this loan will help her pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like soft drinks, fat, and tea leaves

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers at a primary school in the village of Kathan, near Makeni city. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Joseph is the leader of this group. Joseph is a native of Makorombo village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has seven children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Joseph has been a teacher for eighteen years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Angélica es originaria del estado de Chiapas, vive en esta ciudad desde hace varios años y ha salido adelante trabajando desde hace cinco años atendiendo la cooperativa de una escuela, además recibe becas de apoyo para los estudios de sus hijos.  Actualmente esta separada de su esposo.  Comenta que en tiempo de vacaciones trabaja temporalmente mientras inicia el ciclo escolar.
La Sra. Angélica cubrirá los gastos de inscripciones de sus hijos que estudian secundaria, preparatoria y universidad.
texts.en: Mrs. Angélica is from the state of Chiapas. She has lived in this city for many years. She has progressed, for the passed five years, working at a cooperative school. In addition to pay, she receives scholarships so that her children can study here. Actually, she is separated from her husband. During the school vacations she does temporary work. Mrs. Angélica would like to pay for the tuition of her children that want a secondary, preparatory and university education.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for her three children.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es originaria de un pueblo llamado Santa Catarina Mechoacan donde la mayoría de las mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de totopos.
Beatriz se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tacos blanditos de cecina, pollo, suadero, barbacoa y tripa.
Doña Beti, como mejor la conocen, lleva vendiendo tacos cinco años y  lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es cuando tiene muchas ventas porque en dos horas termina de vender todos sus tacos. Por otro lado, lo que representa un reto para ella es que ocasiones al tratar de atender a todos sus clientes lo más rápido que puede, ha sufrido varios accidentes al quemarse-
Doña Beti dice que una de las mejores experiencias que ha tenido, relacionadas con su negocio, es que ayuda a sus clientes vendiéndoles fiado. Beti entiende perfectamente a sus clientes pues ella misma en ocasiones también necesita ayuda ecómica y sus clientes la han apoyado para salir de sus problemas.
Beti menciona que una de las características que deben de tener las personas para hacer el tipo de trabajo que ella realiza es ser amable, higiénico y tener una buen sazón.
Pidió su crédito para poder remodelar su carro de tacos y con el dinero que le sobre desea comprar tejas para el techo de su casa.
Le da las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudarla para que pueda seguir con su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz is originally from the town called “Santa Catarina Mechoacan” where most of the women work making potato chips. 
Beatriz makes and sells simple tacos made from dried meat, chicken, barbequed meat, and tripe.
Mrs. Beti, as we know her, has been selling tacos for the past five years. What she likes most about her business is when she has a lot of sales as then she sells all her tacos in two hours. On the other hand, the bad thing about serving so many customers so quickly is that she sometimes gets burns.
Mrs. Beti says that one of the best experiences that she has had, in relation to her business, is to give her customers loans. Beti understands her customers well. Sometimes she needs loans herself. Her customers help her to resolve her problems.
Beti says that some of the characteristics needed to do her type of work are to be friendly, clean and to have good seasonings.
She is asking for this loan in order to remodel her taco cart. With the extra money she would like to buy tiles for the roof of her house.
She is thankful to the Vision Fund for the help that they have given her to continue with her business and improve it.

loans.use: to buy the material needed to remodel her taco cart.

loans.name: Noor's Group

texts.en:
Noor is married with seven children. Five of her children are involved in different kinds of work, while the other two are free and don’t do anything.  

Noor herself is involved in a sewing business. She sews clothes for her relatives and neighboring customers and generates income for the family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transportation services to passengers. He has been in this business for past five years. 

Noor has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in the buying of a rickshaw body because his rickshaw looks too old and rough, and people avoid taking transportation from him. He will replace the seat covers as well.  

Noor is hopeful that the new body and seat covers will give a presentable look to his rickshaw, which will affect his daily and monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Irma vive en la comunidad de Pampa el Coscal distante a 40 km de el Torno, convive con el Sr. Víctor  tiene 6 hijos ya grandes, ellos viven y trabajan  en su misma parcela, ellos se dedican a la agricultura, siembran maíz, sandia, etc. El crédito que ha solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y maíz y todo lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien, toda la familia trabaja junta en la agricultura, todo lo que ellos siembran  la Sra. Irma lo sacan a vender al mercado de el torno, directamente del productor al consumidor, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora, la Sra. Irma está muy orgullosa de sus hijos ya que le ayudan en esta actividad muy sacrificada.
texts.en:
Irma lives in the community of Pampa el Coscal, 40km from El Torno. She lives with her partner Víctor, and has six children who are already grown up. They live and work on the same piece of land. They farm, growing corn, watermelons, etc. 

The loan she has requested is for planting watermelon and corn, and for everything involved in the preparation of the land. Things went well with the previous loan. The entire family works together farming. Irma takes everything they grow to the market in El Torno to sell, directly from producer to consumer. 

They are a very close-knit and hard-working family. Irma is very proud of her children, as they help her in this work in a very self-sacrificing way.

loans.use: To prepare the land and plant corn.

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es:
Martha cuenta con 38 años de edad, está casada con el señor Flavio quien es campesino. La pareja tiene 4 hijos que estudian secundaria y preparatoria. Martha tiene un negocio de lavandería y dice que en este próximo préstamo va a invertir el dinero en el mismo negocio por que necesita comprar más detergente. También quisiera tener otra lavadora y otra secadora: material para tener su lavandería bien equipada. Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora y dice que poco a poco va a hacer crecer su negocio y espera tener mucho trabajo para tener más ganancias. 

Martha es integrante del grupo Las puntuales, dicho grupo está integrado por mujeres trabajadoras y puntuales en todos los aspectos. A continuación se mencionan sus nombres y cada una de las actividades a las que se dedican: Paulina, Elia, Martha, Ernestina, Leibi, Macedonia, Leticia, Alberta, Gloria y Rosa (venta de productos lácteos, lavandería, venta de plásticos y aluminios, venta de ropa, renta de molino de nixtamal, venta de pan, productos de belleza, venta de ropa y accesorios, venta de accesorios y productos de abarrotes).
texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and married to Flavio, a farm laborer. The couple has four children who are studying in secondary or primary school. Martha has a laundry business and says that she is going to invest the money from this next loan in her business, because she needs to buy more detergent. She would also like to have another washer and another dryer, so that she can have a well-equipped launderette. Martha is a very hard-working woman and says that little by little she is going to grow her business, and that she hopes to have a lot of work so that she can earn better profits.

Martha is a member of the Las Puntuales ["The Punctual Ones"] group. This group is made up of women who work hard and are punctual in all respects. The  group members' names and business activities are as follows: Paulina, Elia, Martha, Ernestina, Leibi, Macedonia, Leticia, Alberta, Gloria, and Rosa (dairy sales, launderette, plastic and aluminum sales, clothing sales, corn flour mill rental, bread sales, beauty products, clothing and accessories sales, and grocery and accessories sales.)

loans.use: to buy materials for her laundry service, such as detergents, a washer, and a dryer

loans.name: June Rossanna

texts.es: June de Quevedo tiene 38 años de edad. Empezó su negocio hace 8 años con un capital de $ 30 comprando la mercadería en Guayaquil. Luego de esto poco a poco empezó a ganar clientes ayudándose con el trabajo de manicurista que tenia. Como sus productos van desde pijamas, blusas y pantalones cuando visita a sus clientes les ofrece el servicio. En otras ocasiones realiza visitas recorriendo la ciudad o cuando lo llaman por algún pedido, esto lo realiza solo en el día ya que en las noches es peligroso. June nos comenta que de momento no ha tenido ningún problema con la delincuencia y espera continuar por el mismo camino sin ningún contratiempo. De momento no está casada pero tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida y brinda su apoyo, todo están estudiando en la escuela fiscal. June nos comenta que sus hijos le ayudan en el hogar y le acompañan a recorrer algunas veces en sus tiempo libres. Con el crédito piensa adquirir mercadería para tener variedad y así ofrecerles a sus clientes. Su meta próxima es tener un local en el centro de Quevedo donde poder exhibir su mercadería, June nos dice con seguridad que pronto realizara su sueño.
texts.en:
June is 38 years of age and is from Quevedo. She started her business eight years ago with initial capital of $30, which she used to buy merchandise in Guayaquil. Gradually she began gaining customers with the help of her job as a manicurist. Her inventory of products includes items ranging from pajamas to blouses and trousers. June offers her products to customers whenever she visits them to provide her services as a manicurist. On other occasions, she makes visits by traveling around the city or whenever someone calls her with an order. June works alone in the daytime since it can become dangerous at night. She says that she has not had any problems dealing with crime so far and hopes to continue without any mishaps.

June is not currently married, but she has three children who she cares for and supports. All of them are attending a state school. June says that her children help around the house and occasionally accompany her on her sales trips when they have free time. She plans to use her loan for acquiring merchandise so that she will have variety to offer to her customers. Her next goal is to have a shop in central Quevedo where she can exhibit her merchandise. June says with confidence that she can accomplish her dream very soon.

loans.use: to buy pajamas, blouses, and trousers.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica al taller de estructuras metálicas, es agricultor, y también administra un molino, es una persona de hogar vive con su esposa y un hijo, él aprendió este trabajo por su familia y hace nueve años se dedica de lleno como una manera para poder tener los recursos necesarios.
El está solicitando un préstamo para pagar el alquiler de terreno en el cual espera realizar la siembra, también comprará algunos materiales para el taller como hierro y láminas, espera con este préstamo mejorar sus condiciones poder realizar su vivo de maíz y asimismo tener los materiales necesarios en el taller de estructuras.
Su objetivo es seguir cultivando, aumentar su trabajo en el taller, y así ir desarrollándose y ser más productivo a través de estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Luis operates a metal shop, works as a farmer, and also manages a grain mill. He is the head of his household and lives with his wife and son. Luis learned this line of work from his family and has spent the last nine years earning necessary income in this manner.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay the rent on a piece of farmland on which he hopes to begin planting. He will also buy some materials for his workshop, such as iron and metal sheets. Luis expects that this loan will improve the conditions for growing corn and also provide him with necessary materials for his metal shop. His goals are to continue farming, increasing the level of work in his metal shop, and developing and becoming more productive with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to rent a piece of farmland and to buy materials for his metal shop.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro Alfonso tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos ubicado en un mercado de la ciudad de león,  tiene más 13 años de dedicarse a este negocio siendo una  importante fuente de ingresos para el y su familia.

El  crédito solicitado a Ceprodel fue  utilizado para comprarle directamente a los  productores al por mayor y así por obtener un producto de mayor calidad para ofertarle a su clientela, donde  obtendrá  mayores ganancias, y  eso le pueda permitir mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Alfonso has a small business selling basic grains at a market in the city of León. He has been in this business for more than 13 years since it is an important source of income for him and his family.

The loan he is requesting from CEPRODEL will be used to buy goods directly from the producers in bulk. This will also enable him to obtain a better quality product that he can offer to his customers, thus allowing him to generate more income and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy corn and wheat.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en:
Adalat is 44-year-old man, married with three children. He has bred livestock from a very young age thanks to his father, who taught him well. He already has 10 years of experience. During these years, Adalat has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price in a livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.

His business requires a lot of physical strength, as Adalat spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals.

His monthly income is 150 AZN and Adalat wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put to his business and cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two cattle, one milkier cow and fodder. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one milkier cow and fodder.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is 42 years old, a married man with two children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. He has 20 years of experience, and has deep knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 110 AZN. His son helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in his family. Vahid is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of his hometown.

He applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and to diversify the range of goods to cover his customers` demand. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein, 19, is  from Iraq. He is a youth client who is single and lives with six family members.

Houssein owns a small shop for gadgets. He has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting $2400 as a youth loan to install new shutters and shelves for the shop. Also, he wants to make an advertising light box and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install new shutters and shelves for the shop.

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.en: Safarbek is a hard-working man. His parents are proud of him, especially his brother. Safarbek’s brother helps him in the business. They help local people with printing. Safarbek has some computers with which he works: printing, copying, etc. Already four years into the business, Safarbek and his brother are busy and earning a living in this way. Safarbek is married and has one child. His aim is to buy new computers to develop the business.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 29 and married with two dependent children, one daughter and one son, who are still in school. Sinat and her husband live in a wooden house and earn a living by farming rice and growing cassava. Having been in this business for almost 10 years, she is able to earn around 19,000 KHR per day to support her family. The drop in the price of cassava is still a main challenge for her business. 

Sinat has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and she completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to better support her family. Now, she and a group member who has been with VisionFund for one cycle are applying for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and seed for her cassava business. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and seed for her cassava business.

loans.name: Krorn's Group

texts.en:
Krorn is 47 years old and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Cambodia. She has six children and four are dependent children. Only one of her dependent children is still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for 10 years. This business earns her around 24,000 KHR per day for daily expenses. 

Krorn’s group consists of two members and she is the fifth cycled client while her group member is the third cycled client with VisionFund. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price and also hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Qaroglan

texts.en:
Qaroglan is 48 years old, married with four children. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Qaroglan has 24 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 170 AZN. His wife and son help him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

Qaroglan would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will purchase and diversify with additional food stuffs. He has a positive loan history and this will be his third loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.en: Mikim is a man who is good in private and in public. He is safe and sound, which always helps him in his jobs. He is a driver and also he is busy with selling food. Mikim’s food shop is situated in his house. He sells fruits, vegetables and other food products for the local people. He is married and his wife is a teacher. They have four children. The elder son helps his father in the business. They want to live in comfort and that’s why all members of his family try to do their best. His aim is to buy spare parts of machines with which he works and to buy goods for his food shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car and goods for his food shop.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo lives with her husband and her 8 children, all of whom attend school. Mlongo has a small store in her home, which has stayed open thanks to her work and dedication. For her the customers come first, which is why she always tries to take care of them with a smile and a friendly attitude. Her dream is to see her business flourish to where she has a lot of customers and they always find what they are looking for. She would like to be able to satisfy a larger demand in order to increase her sales and income so that she can give her family a different reality. This has motivated her to request a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust to invest in the purchase of items for her store like oil, rice, beans, sugar, snacks, detergent, sweet rolls, etc. that will help her achieve her dream. She has full confidence that she will get good results that will allow her to reach the quality of life that she wants.

loans.use: to purchase items for her store like oil, rice, beans, sugar, snacks, detergent, sweet rolls, etc.

loans.name: Ta-Kar-Su Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in the village of Sanda Loko, in northern Sierra Leone forty-five years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has one child, who is attending secondary school. 

For many years now, Mohamed has been selling used clothes. With the help of this loan, members of this group will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mohamed is going to use his share of the loan to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Bunna's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29, Bunna is a married mother of four dependent children, two of whom are still in school while the other two are too young to attend school. Like other villagers, rice farming and cassava planting are the primary sources of the family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for almost ten years. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to better support her family.

Bunna’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. Having been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, she is able to better feed her family and now she can earn up to around 13,000 KHR per day. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income from her current business so as to afford to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is age 40 and a responsible mother of four children, living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is a local rice farmer and also a chef who offers a cook service for wedding parties or funerals in her community. She occasionally works with her team to provide this service. However, her husband is the main income provider of the family. He works hard in the construction field to support the family. 

Due to the lack of a vehicle for use in the family, Chan would like to take out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for household use. She said that it will provide more comfortable transportation than any taxi services. Chan hopes that she will be able to support all of her children until they graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул  - лидер группы «Роза», ей 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Назгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  в хозяйстве Назгул имеется 1 корова и 1 лошадь, выручка с продажи молока составляет 2,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку ягнят.  Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nazgul is a leader of the Rosa group. She is 35 years old, married and is raising 3 children. Animal husbandry is a main source of income for Nazgul and her family. Having started her business with 10,000 som (KGS), today Nazgul's farm counts 1 cow and 1 horse, and the monthly income from the sale of milk amounts to 2,000 som.
In order to further develop her business, Nazgul turned to the organization Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase lambs. Nazgul is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into further business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dariyka

texts.ru:
Дарийка  - участник группы «Роза», ей 34 года, замужем, имеет 3  детей. Дарийка в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Дарийки имеется 1 корова  с теленком,  1,7 га земли, где она выращивает картофель и пшеницу. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дарийка обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Дарийка планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Dariyka is a member of the Rosa Group. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. Animal husbandry and crop-farming are the main sources of income for Dariyka and her family. As of today, Dariyka's farm counts 1 cow with a calf, 1 horse and a 1.7 ha of land where she grows potatoes and corn.
In order to further develop her business, Dariyka has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase young livestock. Dariyka is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into further business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.ru:
Айгерим  - участник группы «Роза», ей 21 год, замужем, имеет 2-месячного ребенка. Айгерим в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Айгерим имеется 1 корова  с теленком, 1 лошадь, 1,4 га земли, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгерим обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Айгерим планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Aigerim is a Rosa Group member. She is 21 years old, married and has a 2-month baby. Animal husbandry and crop-farming are the main sources of income for Aigerim and her family. As of today, Aigerim's farm counts 1 cow with a calf, 1 horse and a 1.4-ha plot of land where Aigerim grows potatoes and maize.
In order to further develop her business, Aigerim has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to purchase young livestock. Aigerim is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into further business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Azer

texts.ru: Azer uje 5 let kak rabotayet taxistom, ranshe on vodil avtobus, no potom on kupil svoyu mashinu i teper on vodit taxi. Azer 46 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 prekrasnix detey. Azer yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda kotoriy seychas okkupirovan. Azer i yego jenat i deti seychas jivut v Fizuli regione. Azer ochen nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit shini (dlya kolos)tak kak oni u nego uje isporchenniye i on ne mojet takimi shinami otvozit kliyentov, tak kak on dumayet ob udobstve i bezopasnosti kliyentov. AZer ochen vnimatelniy i opitniy voditel i etim on dobilsya uvajeniya i predpochteniya sredi kliyentov.
texts.en:
Azer has been working as a taxi driver for five years already.  He used to drive a bus, but then he bought his own car and he now drives a taxi.  He is 46 years old.  He is married and has two beautiful children.

Azer is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the town of Fuzuli, which is now occupied.  He currently lives with his wife and children in the Fuzuli region.

Azer really needs 1,600 AZN to buy new tires for his taxi; his current tires are damaged and he cannot take clients in his taxi, as he is concerned about their comfort and safety.

Azer is a very attentive and experienced driver, this is how he has gained his clients' respect and preference.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru: Elchin 26 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elchin uje 2 qoda kak otkril svoy magazin dlya prodaji produktov. Elchin yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Elchin nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya prodaji v svoyom magazine. On xochet uvelichti svoi mesachniye doxodit chtobi on smog uje jenitysa i zavesti svoyu semyu i detey. Elchin ochen trudolubiviy i chestniy chelovek.
texts.en: Elchin is 26 years old. He is not married and does not have children. Elchin opened a food store 2 years ago. Elchin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). Earlier he lived in the Fuzuli city, but had to flee to the Fuzuli Region where he currently lives with his family. Elchin needs AZN 1,600 to purchase food products for his store. He would like to increase his monthly income so that he can finally marry and have children. Elchin is a very industrious and honest person.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale in his store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years of age and a widow who supports three children aged 20, 12 and 10 years respectively. Elizabeth runs a secondhand clothing business. She has been in this business for 15 years and the business brings in a monthly income of Ksh. 20,000.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying her first loan. She will use the borrowed loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothes for resale. With the anticipated profits from her business, she plans to repay her loan and use the remaining amount to pay her children’s school fees.  

She hopes to build a stall for running her business and hopes that her business prospers so as to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zukure

texts.en: Zukure is a wonderful man who likes to work very hard. From childhood he was good in studying as in collective farming. He works hard and lovingly in agricultural land. Zukure raises watermelon, peas, corn and cotton. His products have many customers. He is married and has 6 children. His wife helps him in business. His aim is to buy mineral resources.

loans.use: To buy mineral resources

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Anar jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda (okkupirovannix territoriy Karabakha).Anar jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Yemu 30 let. On uje 4 goda kak zanimayetsya prodajey pishevix produktov v svoyom magazine. Seychas on nudjayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi zdelat novshestva v svoyom biznesse, on xochet kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya prodaji v svoyom magazine ,ranee on prodoval tolko pisheviye produkti. Anar uvidel chto sredi pokupateley yest bolshoy spros na moyushiye sredstvai poetomu on reshil razvit svoy bizness.
texts.en: Anar and his family live in the Fuzuli Region. Anar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) - a refugee from the Fuzuli city (the occupied territories of the Karabakh). Anar is married and has three children. He is 30 years old. He owns a store and has been engaged in foodstuff sales for 4 years. Anar now needs AZN 2,000 to diversify his business and buy cleaning agents and materials. He used to sell only food products in his store. Anar decided to diversify his business and start selling cleaning products because he realized they were in high demand.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, a 38-year-old married man, is an accountant supporting a family of five members.

Other than being an accountant, Mohammad has some land where he wants to plant and build a greenhouse, for which he has applied for this loan to buy the tools and materials needed to do so.

loans.use: to buy the tools and materials needed to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29 years old, married and has three children.

Wissam has owned a shop since 2010, selling women’s clothing, accessories and perfumes. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a youth loan to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent

loans.name: Bubaim

texts.ru:
Бубаим  - лидер группы «Ынтымак 22», ей 56 лет, работает учителем в школе. В  2000 году , в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Бубаим начала свой бизнес в  производстве национальных рукотворных ковров ("шырдак") из войлока со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Создав свою группу  и наладив производство посредством  совместного закупа материалов и надомного исполнения заказов, группа имеет доход от продажи своей продукции около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубаим обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп необходимого сырья. Доходы от кредита Бубаим совместно с группой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса посредством покупки машинки для пошива национальных головных уборов колпак.
texts.en:
Bubaim is a leader of the Yntymak 22 Group. She is 56 years old and is a school teacher. Seeking an additional source of income for her family back in 2000, Bubaim set up her business of producing national handmade felt carpets (shyrdak) with 5,000 som (KGS). Having created their own group and set up the production by means of joint efforts in material purchasing and work from home, the Group's monthly income from the sale of their products amounts to 20,000 som (KGS).
In order to further develop her business, Bubaim turned to the organization Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase necessary carpet fibers and materials. Bubaim and the Group are planning on investing the earnings from the loan into further business expansion and purchase a sewing machine to make Kyrgyz national hats kalpak.

loans.use: to purchase materials for carpet manufacturing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy margi, onions, pepper, salt, palm oil, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to three sons and two daughters. She works in a store selling clothes and her husband is a carpenter; both are getting an income which is not enough to cover all the family's costs and the educational expenses.

Abeer is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of completing her house, such as installing electric extensions and painting. This will enable  Abeer and her family to move to live in their new house soon, which will improve the family's living conditions.

Abeer is photographed in her new house.

loans.use: To finish the house

loans.name: Dostali

texts.ru: Dostali jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On lubit provodit svoyo svobodnoye vremya so svoyey semyoy. Dostali 28 let. On uje 3 qoda kak imeyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji moyushix i kosmeticheskix sredstv. Dostali po sprosu kliyentov reshil nachat prodaju pishevix produktov. V yego magazine imeyetsya mesto gde on smojet razmestit noviye produkti.Poetomu on seycyhas nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupir pisheviye produkti dlya pereprodaji. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi, seychas on projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svcoyey semyoy.
texts.en: Dostali is married and has 2 children. He loves to spend his free time with his family.  Dostali is 28 years old. He has been an owner of a shop specializing in cleaning products and cosmetics for 3 years.  Dostali decided to start selling food products because the demand for them is high. He has enough space in his store to place the new products; therefore, he now needs AZN 1,600 to purchase food products for resale. Dostali is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) - a refugee from the Fuzuli City, which is currently occupied. Dostali and his family currently live in the Fuzuli Region.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28 years old, single and lives with seven family members.

Ammar is a photographer and owns a studio. He established his business in 2009; therefore, he has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2700 as a youth loan to purchase an electrical generator and a laptop. Also he wants to make an advertising light box. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator and a laptop

loans.name: Tam-Tamneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tam-Tamneh” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Sento is the leader of this group. She is thirty-nine years old and is married to a trader. The couple has five children who are attending secondary schools. Sento sells market food – rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), beans, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Sento will invest in her business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, beans, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 56 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает 2 внуков. Бурул с 1996 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Бурул имеется 4,2 га собственной и 1,2 га арендованной земли, где она выращивает ячмень. Так как прибыль от продажи ячменя носит сезонный и непостоянный характер, Бурул решила расширить свой бизнес за счет животноводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 коровы и 2 ягнят.  Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Burul is a 56-year-old widow and is raising 2 grandchildren. She has been engaged in crop-farming sihce 1996, and started her business from 2,000 som (KGS). As of today, Burul owns 4.2 ha of land and leases a 1.2-ha plot of land where she grows barley. Since growing barley is seasonal and temporal work, Burul decided to expand her business by breeding cattle. In order to further develop her business, Burul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase 1 cow and 2 lambs. Burul is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into further business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock
